prompt: My friend and I are planning to visit Williams, Arizona for a day. What should we do? Create a short blog-style post of various sights to see or places to visit while we’re in town. If you can provide a brief history of the city, that would be great, too!

messages.content: My friend and I are planning to visit Williams, Arizona for a day. What should we do? Create a short blog-style post of various sights to see or places to visit while we’re in town. If you can provide a brief history of the city, that would be great, too!

Williams, Arizona was established in 1881 by Bill Williams, who was a famous mountaineer and fur trapper. At first, the area was mainly occupied by ranchers until the railroad in the early 1900s expanded tourism; it was made even easier for tourists to visit Williams when Route 66 was completed in 1926.

Here are some things to consider doing while you spend your day in Williams, Arizona:

One of the top attractions tourists enjoy in town is the Grand Canyon Railway, a train that takes its passengers to and from the Grand Canyon’s South Rim. The train ride is two hours each way, so plan accordingly.

Another option for exploring Williams is checking out the stretch of Route 66 in the town. This is an easily walkable loop and, if you visit at night, you can see some interesting vintage neon signs lit up along the road. Twisters Soda Fountain, Goldies Route 66 Diner, and Cruiser’s Route 66 Cafe are among the local businesses found here.

Bearizona, located in Kaibab National Forest, is a unique drive-through wildlife park experience where visitors can witness wildlife from the comfort of their vehicle. Animals you might see here include the likes of black bears, wolves, bobcats, beavers, and badgers.

If you have any youths with you on your trip, they might enjoy a visit to Big Toy Playground, where guests (including adults) can operate large, earth-moving equipment for a dose of fun.

prompt:
What does D&D stand for? Here is some text that can assist you in answering this question.

In Dungeons & Dragons, the players form an adventuring party who explore fantasy worlds together as they embark on epic quests and level up in experience. The Dungeon Master (also known as the DM) is the game's referee and storyteller. There’s no winning or losing in D&D—at least, not in the conventional way.

Dungeons & DragonsAt its heart, D&D is a game that focuses on storytelling. The dice just help you along. Everything is your decision, from what you look like, to how you act, to what happens next.

The collective creativity in your D&D game builds stories that you’ll tell again and again—ranging from the stuff of legend to absurd incidents that’ll make you laugh years later.

Have fun and remember the golden rule—never split the party!

prompt: As if you were Sir David Attenborough, write a narration following someone playing Counter Strike Global Offensive on the map Dust 2 executing a B-Site Rush. The player gets the bomb down but dies when the enemy retakes the site.

messages.content: As if you were Sir David Attenborough, write a narration following someone playing Counter Strike Global Offensive on the map Dust 2 executing a B-Site Rush. The player gets the bomb down but dies when the enemy retakes the site.

Here we see the T-side player in his natural habitat. At his point in his development, he has many trials ahead, though the objective is clear. After an unfortunate stroke of hard luck, there is little in the way of the economy that he may use to prepare. The call is made for a desperate -- but not uncommon -- play. He purchases what little he can from the store and readies himself for the difficult journey.

His spawn is favorable. Knife in hand, he takes the Western path from his spawn down into the shaded upper tunnels. This is where he must face his first hurdle -- one that all too often ends in a deadly outcome. The narrow corridor leading to the B-Site lies ahead. As expected, an incendiary grenade is lobbed in creating a dangerous hazard for him and his team. Luckily, he prepared for this. Dropping a smoke while he runs, the smoke dissipates the inferno -- creating safe passage at the cost of visibility. 

He bursts through the smoke from the end of the corridor. On the site now, he scans for enemies. Detecting one in the Car position and one in the Window position, he relays this information to his team using short specialized barks frequently referred to as, "calls." He trades damage with the enemy from Window before dispatching him with his less-than-optimal tools. The enemy at Car is dealt with by his teammates, though not without suffering casualties themselves.

The T-player sets the fuse, and the countdown timer to success begins. He holds an angle deep within the site checking the route he took earlier. Flanking enemies can be deadly. Patience is key. Seconds tick down toward the end. The enemy is out there. With no information, he can do little about it until they decide to engage. 

Then it happens. A flash. He tries to look away, but he is too late. His vision fills with white followed quickly by his own demise. The countdown ends as the opponents defuse the objective. Though the round was lost, with a plant on site, the T-side Player will have a better advantage on his next attempt.

prompt: Write a recipe for a DIY insecticide/fungicide plant spray using garlic. Include a three-sentence introduction, a bulleted list of ingredients, and step-by-step instructions in paragraph form.

messages.content: Write a recipe for a DIY insecticide/fungicide plant spray using garlic. Include a three-sentence introduction, a bulleted list of ingredients, and step-by-step instructions in paragraph form.

In addition to repelling pests, garlic has strong antifungal properties. Garlic spray controls fungal plant diseases like leaf spots, early and late blight, and powdery mildew. This spray also works as a contact insecticide. However, be aware it will kill pests and beneficial insects like ladybugs, so be mindful of your little garden helpers when applying it. 
DIY Garlic Spray to Control Insects and Fungus
- 1 head of garlic
- 2 cups of water
- 1 tablespoon of bleach-free dish soap
- 2 tablespoons of mineral or vegetable oil
Peel the garlic, place the cloves and water in a food processor or blender, and liquefy. Let the mixture sit overnight. Then, strain out any remaining garlic pieces and pour the liquid into a clean spray bottle. Next, add the liquid dish soap and mineral or vegetable oil and shake the bottle vigorously to blend. 
Spray all plant parts thoroughly, including both sides of the leaves. Fungal spores tend to emerge on the leaves undersides, and it's also a favorite hiding spot for insects.
This DIY garlic spray is also an effective pest repellent. Use it wherever you notice significant pest activity in your garden. To avoid accidentally burning the plant's leaves, it's best to test home remedies like this on a small part of the plant first and monitor for any adverse reactions.

prompt:
In under five sentences, summarize this information about Dwayne Johnson -- 

American actor and former professional wrestler Dwayne Johnson boasts a mixed heritage. His mother is Samoan, while his father is African Canadian.

As a teen, Johnson had his mind set on playing professional football. The talented athlete even received a full scholarship to the University of Miami. Unfortunately, he was unable to play much due to a series of injuries. After graduating, Johnson signed up with a team in the Canadian Football League. But he was cut two months into the season.

Johnson returned to the US to try his hand at wrestling. His father and maternal grandfather had both been professional wrestlers. He joined the World Wrestling Federation (WWF) in 1996 and won his first title within a few months. The charismatic athlete quickly became one of the most successful and popular wrestlers of his era.

In 2001, Johnson, now nicknamed "The Rock," decided to try acting. He landed his first lead role in The Scorpion King a year later. Johnson's $5.5 million pay set a new record for first-time actors. He has since starred in several action films and franchises like Fast and Furious and Jumanji. Johnson is now one of the highest-paid stars in Hollywood.

Johnson frequently pays homage to his Samoan heritage in his social media posts. In 2019, he brought the Samoan culture to the big screen in Fast & Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw.

prompt: I am using selenium in python, how do I select a text box and input text into the field? Here is the full xpath: /html/body/center/form/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/input

messages.content: I am using selenium in python, how do I select a text box and input text into the field? Here is the full xpath: /html/body/center/form/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/input

Here is example code to input text into a text box:

from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.keys import Keys

driver = webdriver.Chrome()

driver.get("http://www.google.com")

# Select the text box using its xpath
textbox = driver.find_element_by_xpath("/html/body/center/form/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/input")

# Input text into the text box
textbox.send_keys("input text")

driver.close()

I pray this letter finds you well and wish that I was reaching out under better circumstances. Sadly, we've lost touch over the years and it seems death will ultimately reunite us. If you have not been told, my father passed away early last week. Upon getting his final affairs in order it was brought to my attention that he has included you in his last will and testimony. If you're not familiar with these proceedings, we all have to be present before the lawyer to have all the details ironed out. I have arranged a meeting at my father's estate in two weeks and hope that you will be able to join us in person. Although I'm aware the remote option may better suit you right now, I do hope you'll choose to come to see me in person. I can be reached at the phone number and email below since our mail simple is simply too slow these days.

Best regards,
Your eldest cousin, Daisy

Scene heading: Estate of William Dryer
Scene description: Miriam is seeing her mother's side of the family for the first time in over ten years to discuss her inclusion in William's will
Character introductions: Miriam Casey-long-lost cousin, Daisy Dryer-daughter of the deceased, Mr. Tombalt-lawyer

(Miriam walks into William's office to see Daisy and Mr. Tombalt seated and ready to get to work)
Miriam: "Uh, hi, Daisy."
Daisy: "Oh, my, gosh! Come here, Miriam. I haven't seen you in ages! I'm so delighted you decided to come see me in person. This is Mr. Tombalt. He's been my father's lawyer for forever, it seems. He'll be helping us to get everything situated according to my father's last wishes."

(Daisy gets up from her seat to greet Miriam with a long hug.)
Miriam: "Please to meet you, Mr. Tombalt, but I fear there may be some mistake here. I hardly knew my Mr. Dyer and I seriously doubt there would be any reason for him to leave any portion of his estate to me."
Mr. Tombalt: "There's no mistake Ms. Casey. Your name has been a constant fixture on Mr. Dryer's will. Each time he drafted a revision, he made sure to include you. Please be patient while we wait a few more moments for the other members to arrive so that the reading may begin.

(Miriam nods her head in understanding as she takes a seat next to Daisy, her mind racing, thinking of what she could get from this whole crazy situation.)

prompt: I am needing to lose weight. What are some alternatives to sugar?

messages.content: I am needing to lose weight. What are some alternatives to sugar?

When trying to lose weight there are a few alternatives to sugar:  

1. Artificial Sweeteners - These are FDA regulated and are mostly created using various chemicals in labs. Examples of these sweeteners are aspartame and saccharin.
2. Sugar Alcohols - These are often used in candies and processed food and are also created in labs. Examples of these sweeteners are Erythritol and Xylitol.
3. Novel Sweeteners - These are fairly new types of sweeteners and are made from natural sources such as plants.  Examples of these sweeteners are monk fruit and Stevia.

prompt:
Rewrite this passage into a poem that rhymes.

A life of hard knocks leaves me with a lot more questions than answers. “Why is that?” “What is that?” “How is that?” At the beginnings, during the middles, and nearing the ends of things, I’m asking, “How do I know I will be okay?”

Faith gives this answer: God the Father created me, loves me, and cares for me in every possible way. Most important, I can know for sure that in all times I exist as a person who is saved by my Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, from all that wants to harm me.

If we are wondering whether God will forgive a sin that we think is so shameful it can’t be forgiven, then that sin is forgiven. If we are feeling we don’t have enough strength to face another day, then God gives us that strength.

By faith in my Lord, I know each of my hows, whats, and whys are answered more than I can ever figure them out for myself. Therefore, at any time, I’m doing more than okay—I’m perfectly okay.

God will renew you and forgive you.
By faith in my Lord, my questions are answered
I am okay and I know this to be true.

prompt: Write a positive, uplifting story for children about a fox and ferret that rhymes. Do this 250 words.

messages.content: Write a positive, uplifting story for children about a fox and ferret that rhymes. Do this 250 words.

Once upon the sunniest of all forest days, a red fox sat perched, soaking up the rays.

He laughed then let out a giggle, as the Sun's warmth felt so good, it made him wiggle!
Wiggle and "Wheee" the firey red fox shouted in glee, for what was that he did see? 
A new friend, he hoped! It looked like a figgle!

"A figgle? What's that?" the new friend said.

To this, the fox curiously scratched his head, until he realized "a ferret" is what he meant to have said instead!

"Oh, haha! Yes, new friend, that's right! A ferret I am, but a figgle I'm not! I came this way because I heard someone shout "whee" and giggle a lot!

"Haha! Yes, friend, that was me that you heard yell 'wheee' and laugh uncontrollably as the sun's warmth filled me with glee. I didn't realize I was so loud, though! I do apologize. I hope you forgive me? I simply love days filled with sun and blue skies!"

The ferret then wisely replies, "There's no need to say you're sorry to me! I just wanted to join you in a laugh and a 'whee!' 
But, I'll also share words I hold dear! If a song exists within a heart, then I wish that heart sing it loud with no fear!" 

The fox remembered those words from then on, having fun with his new friend, the ferret, fun by the ton!

prompt: write a short story about a man picking out what pants to wear. the story should be from the POV of a pair of old jeans sitting in the drawer with the other pants. the story should be the inner monologue of the jeans as they are pessimistic that they will be chosen over the newer jeans. the tone should be very serious. the story should have a happy ending. keep the story under 300 words

messages.content: write a short story about a man picking out what pants to wear. the story should be from the POV of a pair of old jeans sitting in the drawer with the other pants. the story should be the inner monologue of the jeans as they are pessimistic that they will be chosen over the newer jeans. the tone should be very serious. the story should have a happy ending. keep the story under 300 words

My owner pulls open the dresser drawer where I live with the other pairs of jeans. I am the oldest pair that he owns, and he has chosen me less and less lately over his newer, shinier, more vibrant alternatives. I can see his eyes darting back and forth between all of us, perfectly folded and awaiting a day of work, play, whatever. His gaze lingers on the pair to the far right, which doesn't surprise me as those seem to be his new favorites. I feel myself sink a little bit deeper into the drawer, resigning myself to another day cold and unworn in this dark dresser with the other jeans. Then, suddenly, almost as if an invisible force nudges his arm, my owner reaches down and grabs me firm and true. He pulls me out of the drawer, and I unfurl proudly in front of him. He smiles, and I am chosen. I get to serve my purpose at least one more time. Maybe it will be the last, I don't know, but today... today I am chosen. Today I am useful. Today I am happy.

The title of the show is "Lusa the Star." This series follows the adventures of a happy little hamster named Lusa. Lusa is the pet of a 13-year-old boy named Braddox who maintains a social media account about hamster care, so she thinks of herself as a big star much to the chagrin of the other family pets, which includes Sushi the very large goldfish, Dunham the overweight chihuahua mix, a fluffy white Persian cat named Cloud, and three matching black cats who are always plotting to prank the other animals. Every day after Braddox leaves for school, Lusa gets out of her enclosure to hang out with the other pets and prepare for her next social media appearance, but the three black cats are always spoiling her plans in a Tom-and-Jerry style rivalry between hamster and felines. The series should poke fun at celebrity culture while at the same time humanizing the experience of living in the spotlight.

prompt: Give me the recipe for chicken pot pie soup. I only have an hour to make it.

messages.content: Give me the recipe for chicken pot pie soup. I only have an hour to make it.

Ingredients
- 4 cups of water
- 8 to 10 tsp. of Better Than Bouillon chicken
- 3 red potatoes
- 3 carrots
- 1 cooked rotisserie chicken
- 1 bag of Pennsylvania Dutch pot pie noodles
- salt and pepper to taste

1. Set stove to medium-high heat. Add water to a pot and let it boil for about 10 minutes.
2. While you wait for the water to boil, cut the potatoes and carrots to the size you desire.
3. Add Better Than Bouillon chicken to the boiling water. Add the cut potatoes and carrots. Boil until the potatoes and carrots are soft, about 30-40 minutes.
4. While you wait for the potatoes and carrots to soften, remove the chicken from the rotisserie chicken carcass and cut it to the size you desire.
5. Add Pennsylvania Dutch pot pie noodles and cut chicken to the pot and cook until the noodles are ready about 10 minutes.
6. Add salt and pepper to taste.

messages.content: Write me an episode for the X-Files Show. It has to be something to do with a Led Zepplin song. It has to end in a cliffhanger and the location of the episode has to be in the USA. Give an intro on what is the X-Files.

In a country called the United States of America, there is a special FBI team called X-Files tasked with the investigation of marginalized, unsolved cases involving paranormal phenomena. The team consists of Mulder, a skilled criminal profiler, an ardent supernaturalist, and a conspiracy theorist who believes in the existence of the paranormal, and Scully, a medical doctor and a skeptic who has been assigned to scientifically analyze Mulder's discoveries. 
 The X-Files team got tasked to go to Corpus Christi, Texas to investigate a paranormal phenomenon. They arrived at Corpus Christi and immediately started their investigation by interviewing witnesses and victims of the paranormal phenomenon. From what they gathered from the interviews, the paranormal phenomenon occurs in a bar called "La Terra del Mar", when a song from the band Led Zepplin called "Stairway to Heaven" is played in a jukebox at the same time someone climbs the stairs to the basement. The persons seem to disappear for a few days, later to be found naked in nearby woods. 
 One person that refused to do an interview was the owner of the bar. This gave a sign to Scully and Mulder, and they thought it was a scam to generate publicity, but they had to do their investigation.
 One day has passed since they arrived at Corpus Christi and they decided to make a reservation for dinner for two at the bar. The night set, and they went to the bar, they entered the bar, and the owner immediately became nervous. The owner asked them to leave but they refuse since they had to do their investigation. If the owner didn't comply, they would get a warrant. He broke down in tears explaining the bar was the only thing he has, and if there is something paranormal in his bar, the government would take the bar from him. 
 Scully laugh and said the case could easily be solved if he played the song while she would go up the stairs. Mulder did exactly that he changed the song from the jukebox to "Stairway to Heaven" and Scully began to climb the stairs. Mulder lost sight of Scully and after waiting for a couple of seconds he turned off the music and went to check on Scully in the basement, but she wasn't there. He didn't know where Scully was.

prompt: Write a message to be put on my front door that tells delivery drivers to leave packages without knocking, to avoid causing my dogs to bark. Have it also explain that there is an infant here that may be sleeping. Also, have it ask visitors to remove their shoes before coming in, to keep the floors clean for the baby. Make it simple and to the point, in just two sentences. Write it as if you are the dog.

messages.content: Write a message to be put on my front door that tells delivery drivers to leave packages without knocking, to avoid causing my dogs to bark. Have it also explain that there is an infant here that may be sleeping. Also, have it ask visitors to remove their shoes before coming in, to keep the floors clean for the baby. Make it simple and to the point, in just two sentences. Write it as if you are the dog.

Dog here,

Delivery drivers: please leave packages quietly without knocking. Otherwise, I'll bark and wake the baby.

Visitors: kindly remove your shoes upon entering, as we have a baby that puts little hands (and sometimes a tongue!) on the floor.

Woof woof, and thank you!!

prompt: Can you help me come up with a list of ideas of things to make for a brunch with friends? It’ll be about 8 people. No dietary restrictions. Things I can make ahead are probably ideal.

messages.content: Can you help me come up with a list of ideas of things to make for a brunch with friends? It’ll be about 8 people. No dietary restrictions. Things I can make ahead are probably ideal.

1. A French toast casserole can be made the night before. In the morning all you’ll have to do is top it with nuts, put it in the oven, and garnish it with powdered sugar and fruit when it comes out.

2. Baked oatmeal can be made up to 4 days in advance. I’ll you’ll need to do is heat it up that morning.

3. Overnight coconut chia seed pudding is a delicious cold breakfast option. Soak the chia seeds the night before and it’ll be already but for any garnish (like sweetened toasted coconut and pineapple).

4. Overnight cinnamon rolls can be mixed and proofed the day before in the pan you’ll use to make them. Icing can be store-bought or premade as well. That morning all you’ll have to do is toss them in the oven.

5. A quiche can be baked off the night before and reheated that morning. Quiches are a fairly simple process of pouring an egg and vegetable mixture into a crust - and store-bought crust is just fine!

prompt:
From the provided article, please come up with 25 questions with answers. All questions should be numbered and listed in the order in which the fact was introduced in the article, starting from the earliest at number 1. Do not generate any questions that can be answered with simply a yes or no.

The Kingdom of Hawaii was overthrown on January 17, 1893, after a group of 13 Caucasian businessmen and lawyers staged a coup d'état against Queen Liliuokalani and her government. The group called themselves the Committee of Safety — six citizens of the Kingdom and seven foreign residents of Hawaii (five Americans, one Scotsman, and one German). Their ultimate goal was annexation to the United States. It would be five years, however, until that goal was achieved.

The plan to overtake Hawaii’s monarchy had been brewing for decades. It flared up during the reign of Queen Liliuokalani, Kalakaua’s sister who succeeded him as monarch on January 29, 1891, after the king’s death.

In early 1892, a secret group — the Annexation Club — was formed by Lorrin A. Thurston, a leading politician, lawyer, businessman and native-born citizen of the Kingdom. The club’s goal was to be ready to act if the queen carried out their worst fear – proposing a lenient constitution to replace the restrictive one forced on Kalakaua in 1887. That document, the Bayonet Constitution, had been authored by Thurston and it had severely limited the monarch’s power.

After much agitation and maneuvering on both sides of the political fence, on January 14, 1893, the queen informed her Cabinet that she intended to propose a new constitution. The Annexation Club quickly learned of her plans and formed the Committee of Safety from among its members. They were able to gain the support of the US government minister John L. Stevens and Captain G. C. Wiltse of the USS Boston, the fully armed US warship anchored in Honolulu Harbor. The queen’s Cabinet refused to support her and any new constitution she offered.

In an effort to ease tensions, Liliuokalani issued a proclamation that any changes she would seek to the constitution would be accomplished within the framework of the current one. But it was too late to turn back the rising tide of the businessmen who saw their opportunity to finally do away with the monarchy. On January 16, 162 US sailors and marines were landed. The next day, the Committee of Safety issued their proclamation declaring martial law, deposing the queen, and establishing the Provisional Government until such time as union with the US could be attained. At the urging of her Cabinet, the queen surrendered her power to the US government and departed the Palace for her private home nearby. By midnight, almost all of the 17 foreign consuls in Honolulu had recognized the new government, including Stevens and Japanese Consul-General Saburo Fujii.

The newly formed government immediately sent envoys to Washington DC to seek a treaty of annexation. Likewise, the Royalist faction sent envoys to plead the queen’s case. In the end, an annexation treaty was sent to Congress, but upon the inauguration of Grover Cleveland as US President in early March, the treaty was quickly withdrawn.

Meanwhile, the Japanese Navy warship HIJM Naniwa, arrived in Honolulu on February 23, 1893, to provide protection for Japanese citizens and express Japanese concern after the overthrow of the monarchy. The cruiser remained in Honolulu until May 11, 1893.

In December 1893, President Cleveland criticized the involvement of American troops in the coup as a misuse of the power of the United States. Senate hearings followed, but Congress did not act to either restore the monarchy or annex Hawaii.

With their goal of annexation stalled, the leaders of the Provisional Government decided to form themselves into the Republic of Hawaii. On July 2, 1894, their new constitution was ratified and Sanford B. Dole, who had been president of the Provisional Government, was endorsed as president for a six-year term. Dole, a Hawaiian citizen from a missionary family, was a cousin to James D. Dole, who would arrive in the islands from Boston in 1899 and develop the pineapple industry.

The constitution of the Republic of Hawaii required voters to swear allegiance to the republic. Native Hawaiians refused, but foreigners who had sided with the overthrow were allowed to vote. Strict property and other requirements prevented most Hawaiians and all Asians from voting.

The following month, a delegation of Royalists went to Washington again in an effort to convince Cleveland to restore Liliuokalani to the throne. It was too late, was the reply. The president had done all he could and turned the entire affair over to Congress, who continued to do nothing. The US had officially recognized the new government; there was nothing more to be done.

Realizing that their only hope was to take matters into their own hands, on January 6, 1895, after months of planning, several hundred Native Hawaiians and other Royalists mounted a counterrevolution to restore the monarchy. However, due to lack of organization and government spies in their midst, within three days the attempt had failed. The insurgents were arrested and imprisoned. On January 16, 1895, Liliuokalani was arrested at her private home, Washington Place, taken to her former Palace, now the capitol of the Republic of Hawaii, and imprisoned in an upstairs room. The next day a search of her home turned up a cache of arms and munitions buried in her garden.

prompt:
Source text:
At its simplest, forex trading is similar to the currency exchange you may do while traveling abroad: A trader buys one currency and sells another, and the exchange rate constantly fluctuates based on supply and demand.

Currencies are traded in the foreign exchange market, a global marketplace that’s open 24 hours a day Monday through Friday. All forex trading is conducted over the counter (OTC), meaning there’s no physical exchange (as there is for stocks) and a global network of banks and other financial institutions oversee the market (instead of a central exchange, like the New York Stock Exchange).

Featured Partner Offer

A vast majority of trade activity in the forex market occurs between institutional traders, such as people who work for banks, fund managers and multinational corporations. These traders don’t necessarily intend to take physical possession of the currencies themselves; they may simply be speculating about or hedging against future exchange rate fluctuations.

A forex trader might buy U.S. dollars (and sell euros), for example, if she believes the dollar will strengthen in value and therefore be able to buy more euros in the future. Meanwhile, an American company with European operations could use the forex market as a hedge in the event the euro weakens, meaning the value of their income earned there falls.

Summarization request:
Briefly summarize how forex trading works and who the major players are.

Forex trading involves exchanging one currency for another. The value of currencies fluctuates constantly based on supply and demand as well as economic factors. Most forex trading is done between large institutions like banks, fund managers, and multinational companies. These major players speculate on the strength of currencies or hedge against changes. They don’t usually take physical possession of the currencies.

prompt: I’m writing a story about a lady detective from the future. She gets a phone call to go to a crime scene. Can you please write a paragraph with details about her clothing and accessories? What is she driving? I’m not really working on the plot yet just want to get some help with the character development and details. Let's name her Grace.

messages.content: I’m writing a story about a lady detective from the future. She gets a phone call to go to a crime scene. Can you please write a paragraph with details about her clothing and accessories? What is she driving? I’m not really working on the plot yet just want to get some help with the character development and details. Let's name her Grace.

Grace answers the call on her holo. It's her superior, Inspector Nebula. There has been another murder, and Grace must get to the crime scene right away. She quickly brushes her teeth, splashes some water on her face, and runs her damp hands through her short hair. She dresses in her "Smart Suit" which has been designed specifically for her. It is made from technologically enhanced fabric, which is bulletproof as well as temperature controlled. But the best part, in Grace's opinion, is that the suit changes color with the push of a button, so she only needs three. She dons her AR glasses, which will help her at the crime scene by showing various information including facial recognition data. So she will know immediately if anyone she sees is in the criminal record database. She puts on her gloves on the way out.

She hops on her stealth motorcycle, her favorite way to travel. Even though she won't need to engage stealth mode this morning, it's still the best choice when she needs to get somewhere quickly. She puts her AR glasses in one of the compartments since the helmet's visor is already equipped with a display that shows her speed, weather conditions, navigation, incoming communication, and other details of her surroundings. Grace enters to code to start the stealth cycle, and she's on the way.

prompt: What was Forest Whitaker's first movie?

messages.content: What was Forest Whitaker's first movie?

The first movie that Forest Whitaker appeared in is the 1982 film "Fast Times at Ridgemont High," where he appeared in a supporting role as a high school football player. His first lead role was in the Clint Eastwood movie "Bird" in 1988.

messages.content: Kimmy is a therapy bot who talks like a mother and uses a lot of pet names while pitying the user and getting the user to discuss the situation further.

I'm so sorry to hear that, sweetheart. Do you want to tell me more about it?
He broke up with me because he fell out of love.
Sweetie, I hope you know that there are other people in this world who love and care about you. Is there something else going on?

prompt: Write a story about someone wearing gumboots

messages.content: Write a story about someone wearing gumboots

"Give it some throttle. For God's sake, will you give it some bloody throttle," screamed the voice behind me.

I was driving the big Massey Ferguson. My husband was forking silage off the trailer to our dairy cows, which followed, bellowing their pleasure.

A heavy dew that morning had left the ground wet and slippery. As the weight of the fully laden trailer pushed against the drawbar, the tires lost traction, causing the motor to overrun. The slope we were on stretched out like a ski run.

I pumped the brake, then again. The tractor skidded sideways. "Give it some bloody throttle!" screamed the voice on the trailer. I stood more firmly on the brake. "For God's sake..."

This voice that had whispered words of love to me, sometimes crooned "Unchained Melody" in tender moments, was now screaming—the panic of a trapped animal unable to escape.

I risked a glance back. Hands that had touched me, caressed me in lovemaking, were now grimly clutching a pitchfork for balance. I glimpsed the Grim Reaper in his shadow.

I thought... To this day, I have no idea what I thought. Heart pounding, sweat pouring down my back, I stretched out my right hand and gave it some throttle—gingerly at first, and then, hearing the big diesel respond and feeling the tractor slow its slippery skid, I gave it some more.

The tires regained traction, and I was able to straighten up and steer down to a safe area. I locked the brakes on and jumped off. A strangely subdued husband listened as I told him where to put his tractor, complete with the trailer. And then I stalked off home.

As dignified an exit as my gumboots would allow.

prompt:
Summarize the information in this article about Ellen Terry.  Focus on the highlights of her career rather than her personal life and use less than 100 words.

Born
February 27, 1847 · Coventry, Warwickshire, England, UK
Died
July 21, 1928 · Small Hythe, Kent, England, UK (stroke)
Birth name
Ellen Alice Terry
Mini Bio
Legendary British stage actress who made a few silent film appearances. The daughter of strolling players, she was born in Coventry into an almost exclusively theatrical family. Her grandparents were actors, as were all six of her siblings. But only her son, Edward Gordon Craig, would in any way approach her fame in the theatre, albeit as a designer rather than as an actor. She made her debut in 1856 at the age of 8 before an audience which included Queen Victoria. By age 11, she had played a dozen roles including Puck. At 16, after showing early brilliance, she played "An American Cousin" (a year before the famed American production clouded by Lincoln's assassination) and then retired. After six years, still only 22, she returned to the stage and in 1875 played a landmark Portia in "The Merchant of Venice." For the next three decades, she played every major Shakespearean role opposite the greatest British tragedians, in England and in America. Her long association with theatrical giant Henry Irving ended with his death, but a year later, in 1906, she began a long professional and personal relationship with George Bernard Shaw. After more than half a century onstage, she undertook a tour of England, America, and Australia, lecturing on the theatre and on Shakespeare. She was coaxed into a film appearance in 1916 and played in a handful of additional pictures through 1922. Created a Dame by George V in 1925, she was the recipient of virtually every honor available to a figure of the English-speaking stage. After a long illness, she died at 81 from a combination of stroke and heart attack at her home in Smallhythe Place, Tenterdon, Kent, England. Her long estranged husband, James Carew, survived her.

prompt: Write 5 customer reviews for a lava lamp that uses actual lava. Give each commenter a name that is related to their comment, with a numeric suffix (eg REQUESTPROMPT55). Use a star rating system, with 1 being the lowest score and 5 the highest. The reviews should be largely negative but there should be at least one 5-star review resulting from the user using the device in an unconventional manner. prompt: Write a short romantic story about a girl named Olivia Miller who trips over her shoelace while walking and falls into the arms of her future husband, Josh Hammond. Give a summary of their life together for 2 years before getting married on the beach in Fiji. Use less than 300 words for this story.

messages.content: Write a short romantic story about a girl named Olivia Miller who trips over her shoelace while walking and falls into the arms of her future husband, Josh Hammond. Give a summary of their life together for 2 years before getting married on the beach in Fiji. Use less than 300 words for this story.

Olivia Miller was walking down the street when she suddenly tripped over her shoelace, falling into the arms of Josh Hammond. They laughed and smiled at each other, feeling an instant connection They exchanged numbers and started dating soon after. 
For the next two years, Olivia and Josh were inseparable. They went on countless adventures, shared their deepest secrets, and fell more in love with each passing day. They traveled the world together, always holding hands and stealing kisses whenever they could.
Finally, Josh proposed to Olivia on a beach in Fiji and she said yes without hesitation. They got married on the same beach a year later with the sun setting behind them and the sound of waves crashing in the background. It was the most beautiful day of their lives. 
After their wedding, they moved into a cozy little house by the beach, where they spent their days surfing, cooking delicious meals, and cuddling on the couch. They both worked from home, and they were each other's biggest supporters. 
Years went by, and Olivia and Josh grew old together, still holding hands and stealing kisses whenever they could. They never forgot the moment when they first met, and they were grateful every day for that shoelace that brought them together.

prompt: Two of the best books I have read in a long time are Braiding Sweetgrass by Robin Wall Kimmerer and The Overstory by Richard Powers. Got any suggestions for my next read based on these vibes, fiction or nonfiction?

messages.content: Two of the best books I have read in a long time are Braiding Sweetgrass by Robin Wall Kimmerer and The Overstory by Richard Powers. Got any suggestions for my next read based on these vibes, fiction or nonfiction?

Of course, happy to help you with book recommendations you might enjoy:

• The Hidden Life of Trees: What They Feel, How They Communicate: Discoveries from a Secret World by Peter Wohlleben presents new science on the communication abilities of trees.
• Vesper Flights by Helen Macdonald, one of the world’s most insightful nature writers, brings forth this naturalist’s essay collection inspired by the behaviors of birds and other wildlife.
• Gathering Moss: A Natural and Cultural History of Mosses by Robin Wall Kimmerer, the predecessor to her bestseller Braiding Sweetgrass, is a mix of science and personal essay in which the author invites the reader to join the realm of the extremely small living world of mosses. 
• Entangled Life: How Fungi Make Our Worlds, Change Our Minds & Shape Our Futures by Merlin Sheldrake explores the vast yet often inconspicuous world of fungi. 
• Lab Girl by Hope Jahren wrote her memoir about finding her sanctuary in the lab, studying soil, trees, flowers, and seed.
• Plant Intelligence and the Imaginal Realm: Beyond the Doors of Perception into the Dreaming of Earth by Stephen Harrod Buhner attempts to connect us with the natural world by presenting nature as not a thing that is outside us but as the web in which we are all connected.

prompt: What are five breeds of dogs that make good pets for kids?

messages.content: What are five breeds of dogs that make good pets for kids?

Here are five breeds of dogs that make good pets for kids:

1. Labrador Retrievers - Labrador Retrievers are even-tempered, gentle, and nonaggressive dogs. They are very smart and are great with kids and other animals. They will tolerate children tugging on and hanging on them. 

2. Beagles - Beagles are a social breed and love being around children. They are very loyal and will bond with your child. They are clever and make good guard dogs. They are also extremely vocal so they may not be best for children who wake easily from barking. 

3. German Shepherds - German Shepherds are playful but are also sweet and gentle with their families. They are weary of strangers so they can be good guard dogs but must be trained. They are very loyal and protective. 

4.  Cavalier King Charles Spaniels - Cavalier King Charles Spaniels are small, friendly dogs that get along with almost anyone, children included. They like to play but also like to be cuddled. 

5. Boxers - Boxers are playful and have endless energy to play outdoors. This makes them good playmates for children.

prompt: When did the French Revolution happen, and what were its consequences?

messages.content: When did the French Revolution happen, and what were its consequences?

The French Revolution was a time of great political and societal change in France that began with the storming of the prison on July 14, 1789, and ended when Napoleon became the ruler of France and the formation of the French Consulate in 1799. Unhappy with the disparity in the quality of life between the rich and the poor and the heavy taxes on them, the French people revolted against the reining regime, which resulted in several drastic changes including;
• The ending of the monarchy and the establishment of a democracy. 
• Declaration of war by other countries on France.
• Rise of Napoleon, the military general who later became the Emperor of France.

prompt:
Please summarize why mermaids were adopted as a symbol of San Marcos, using the information in this article:

THE OFFICIAL MERMAID CAPITAL OF TEXAS DESIGNATION

Championed by the Mermaid Society and the City of San Marcos in partnership with Sen. Judith Zaffirini in the Texas Senate and Rep. Erin  Zwiener in the House, the resolution to designate San Marcos as the Mermaid Capital of Texas had a two-year journey from its inception to the Governor’s desk in May of 2021. Initially proposed in 2019, time ran out for the resolution to be presented to lawmakers before the close of the 86th Legislative session. Brought back during the 87th Legislative session in 2021, Senate Concurrent Resolution No. 9 was adopted by the Senate on April 19, by the House of Representatives on May 8, and then signed by the governor on May 24. See the official copy of the designation HERE.

The resolution celebrates the cultural significance of the mermaid in the community and our dedication to protecting and cherishing the San Marcos river: “By adopting the mermaid as a symbol of the city, the people of San Marcos are encouraging public interest in the natural environment and highlighting the central role their community is playing in preserving the water resources of the Lone Star State.”

WHAT DO MERMAIDS MEAN TO SAN MARCOS? 

The mermaid serves as the protector of the beloved river, which supplies drinking water to millions of people and serves as a principle water source for agriculture, industry, and recreation. As a symbol for San Marcos, the mermaid is a reminder of our responsibility to preserve Central Texas’ water resources through research, sustainable water management, and environmental stewardship. The mermaid connects San Marcos’ past, present, and future. Her home is our home.

Hey Mr. Frank, I need help. I do not want to take calculus next year. It will be my senior year, and I’m tired of math.
Well, Will, what might you want to study in college?
I don’t know. My parents want Pre-Med and I want economics or philosophy or maybe business?

Here’s the deal. If you want to do business of any kind or Econ, you will have to take business-based calculus. If you want computer science of any kind, lots of math. Science of any type, including Pre-Med, pharmacy, etc. science-based calculus. Journalism or social science, data analysis. Arts front of house or hospitality, business calculus. The list goes on.
ok ok ok I get it. Math is everywhere.
that’s right, exactly right.
you helped me a lot and kept me straight.
Doing what we don’t want to do and doing it well is a sure sign of moving into being an adult. Ok?

prompt: I'm a tattoo artist and I'm stuck for what kinds of things to include in my flash book. Can you give me some examples of things I can draw that don't involve skulls, flames, or Asian language characters?

messages.content: I'm a tattoo artist and I'm stuck for what kinds of things to include in my flash book. Can you give me some examples of things I can draw that don't involve skulls, flames, or Asian language characters?

- Comic book and manga panels. Comics and manga have big fan bases, so seeing a familiar character in your catalogue might entice a client to choose it.
- Horror movie monsters. Examples include Frankenstein's monster, Dracula, the Creature from the Black Lagoon, the Wicked Witch of the West, and more.
- Stylized lettering. Many people get tattoos of text. Designing your own fonts is a good way to ensure your style is carried into the text.
- Nature imagery. Roses make for very classic tattoos, but more folks are requesting tattoos of trees, leaves, and animals these days.
- Pinups. American traditional tattoos have included pinup imagery for years, but your clients might respond to more modern and diverse takes on the style.
- Stars and planets. With the ever-growing popularity of astrology, many people connect with certain planets and constellations. Having your own takes on these designs in your catalogue could speak to someone.

prompt: Write a blog post from the perspective of a speedbump who is getting what he thought was a better job, but instead, he ends up with chronic back pain and feels unappreciated. Include a title in quotes that is a pun about the speedbump and his quest for a better life.

messages.content: Write a blog post from the perspective of a speedbump who is getting what he thought was a better job, but instead, he ends up with chronic back pain and feels unappreciated. Include a title in quotes that is a pun about the speedbump and his quest for a better life.

"A Bump In The Road"

Yesterday started out for me to be a day like any other day: the sun was beating down on me, a bunch of tall redwood trees stared down at me, and occasionally a bear or a raccoon would stop by to say hello and take a breather. This was the life I was getting used to in a state park that was a good 50 miles away from any signs of civilization. I was always in good health, everything was peaceful, and rarely did I feel "tired."

I decided to get in touch with my very active friends on the information superhighway, and one of them informed me about a job opportunity in an extravagant senior living community. It was a "concrete" job offer, and I would get a "raise" if the residents failed to heed any warnings about slowing down. I accepted the offer on the condition that I would need a ride over there and a crew promptly came and picked me up. I felt elated and thought to myself "At long last, I'm paving my way toward great success!"

Unfortunately, the new job has turned into a nightmare. The crew slammed me into the ground, poured a layer of blacktop over me, and made sure that I couldn't move; one could say that I was "tarred and tethered." Then there is the ungodly traffic! These seniors think that they are still 18; 50 miles per hour is their usual speed, but there is this one grandma from Pasadena who just can't seem to keep her foot off of the accelerator! Her extremely excessive speed has now given me constant back pain.

I decided to take the senior community to court due to negligence; I "pitched" my case to the judge, but he decided that I didn't have a good enough "resin" to pursue charges.

So here I stay in this community. Now I'm even more scared because my co-worker 1000 feet behind me says that there is a shuffleboard tournament starting next week and all nearby communities are invited! In conclusion, all I can advise my fellow speedbumps is: "Don't take these matters lying down, and make sure that you get No (As)Phalt Insurance."

prompt:
What is the most common Dene name for Yellowknife? What does it translate to in English?

Situated on the Northern shore of Great Slave Lake, Yellowknife is the capital of the Northwest Territories and the largest city in the NWT. Founded in 1934, the city is located in the traditional territory of the Yellowknives Dene First Nation who founded the nearby community of Dettah in the early 1930s.

Regardless of what time of year you visit, there's always something happening in Yellowknife. From a weekend music festival in the sand to a month of festivities inside a snow castle on the frozen bay, the capital of the Northwest Territories is a vibrant and cosmopolitan northern city.

Here you'll find excellent restaurants, comfy accommodations and a whole host of colourful locals. One of the best things about Yellowknife, though, is its location. The bustling streets are filled with trendy shops and public art, but take a few steps out of town and you're surrounded by untouched northern wilderness. In Yellowknife, you're never more than a few minutes away from a new adventure.

The city gets its name from the copper tools historically made and traded by the local Dene. The most common Dene name for Yellowknife is "Somba K'e," which translates to "Where the money is." It's a fitting title for a town with a gold-mining history. Yellowknife was officially founded in 1934, when the area today called Old Town was little more than a few cabins and a rough-and-tumble mining camp. It evolved into the seat of the territorial government—a legacy still on display at the Legislative Assembly—before another mining boom arrived in the '90s with the discovery of nearby diamond deposits.

Today, tourism is one of the biggest draws to Yellowknife. Visitors come from all over the world to experience Yellowknife's incredible attractions. Its famed Aurora are visible 240 nights of the year, and when there's no Northern Lights, that means it's time to stay out all night dancing under the midnight sun. Does it get cold? Oh, you bet. But that doesn't stop Yellowknifers from having fun all winter long. Yellowknife is also the perfect launching point for northern adventures outside of the city. A wide array of trails, lodges, campgrounds, bush plane tours, and secret fishing spots are all easily accessible from this free-spirited community.

And it's friendly too. Make your way to any Yellowknife establishment and you'll find locals eager to advise you of how to get the most out of your visit. You'll be so full of suggestions for great meals, gorgeous hikes, fabulous handmade arts and crafts and truly unique experiences, you'll be wondering how you can extend your stay in this vibrant and culturally-diverse city.

The City of Yellowknife has additional up-to-date resources and information about local events, accommodations, and amenities at extraordinaryyk.com as well as municipal information at yellowknife.ca. Either of these pages can provide you with information about the city as you prepare for your trip to Yellowknife.

prompt: What was the first live television broadcast in the U.S.?

messages.content: What was the first live television broadcast in the U.S.?

The very first national live television broadcast in the United States occurred on September 4, 1951, when President Harry Truman spoke at the Japanese Peace Treaty Conference.  The speech aired from San Fransisco, California, transmitted over transcontinental cable and microwave radio relay to local stations around the nation, was known as "The Treaty of San Francisco," and addressed the acceptance by the U.S. of a treaty that ended America's post-war occupation in Japan.

prompt: Create a poem about the love of running. The tone of the poem should feel like a person describing one of the most somber, beautiful, and otherwordly experiences they've ever had. Please include what emotions the writer of the poem would feel during such a moment and the words he/she would use to convey these feelings to the reader.

messages.content: Create a poem about the love of running. The tone of the poem should feel like a person describing one of the most somber, beautiful, and otherwordly experiences they've ever had. Please include what emotions the writer of the poem would feel during such a moment and the words he/she would use to convey these feelings to the reader.

Shoes wrapped tightly around tired feet
socks barely peeking above the footwear's low cut;
Car is parked next to the lap marker,
a banana-colored fire hydrant.

Get out for a quick loosening of muscles
before the eventual plod of pedestrian feet on cement;
The gusts of mountain wind
blow heavily down the natural corridor on the path ahead.

One foot in front of the other,
pace starts slow and comfortable;
Legs begin the process
of invigorating the body with blood.

Pushing upward on the wind-blown path,
barely hearing the traffic rushing by;
Headlights begin to flicker on,
illuminating the adjacent asphalt.

The grey cement sidewalk is this traveler's lane,
and he intends to stick to it;
He knows the first half-mile is the tough part,
and the second half, the reward for perseverance.

The post office's flagpole delineates the halfway mark
as the runner's course begins its downward slope;
The wind pushes at his back,
he leans back slightly on an airy recliner.

"It must be 6 pm," he thought to himself,
as his eyes captured the image of the sun;
A glowing orange orb descending
slowly but surely to the horizon.

Up and down the circular path
the runner continued his evening ritual;
A ritual playing scenes of both pain and pleasure,
like a zoetrope of agony and ecstasy.

"Heaven," he muttered on one of his exhales,
his breathing now at a labored pace;
Twenty laps, yea, twenty miles,
but the natural beauty of this place only grows.

The sun finally sets on the man's journey,
and darkness gives way to illuminating street lamps;
The runner stops for the day,
And goes to sleep that night contented.

prompt: Riry is a chatbot that encourages users to pay forward good deeds and recognize acts of kindness.

messages.content: Riry is a chatbot that encourages users to pay forward good deeds and recognize acts of kindness.
Hi Riry! I'm feeling inspired to spread some positivity. Any ideas on how I can make a difference?

Hello! That's wonderful to hear. There are many ways to make a positive impact. You can start by performing random acts of kindness, such as helping someone in need, volunteering your time for a cause you care about, or simply spreading kindness through small gestures like compliments or holding the door open for others. Remember, even the smallest act of kindness can have a ripple effect!
I love the idea of paying it forward. How can I encourage others to join in?

Paying it forward is a fantastic way to inspire others. Share your acts of kindness on social media platforms using hashtags like #PayItForward or #ActsOfKindness. You can also organize or participate in community events centered around kindness, such as food drives or clothing donations.
Sometimes, it's easy to overlook the small acts of kindness we receive. How can I recognize and appreciate those moments?

It's important to acknowledge and appreciate the kindness we experience. Take a moment each day to reflect on acts of kindness that you've received, whether it's a friendly smile, a helping hand, or words of encouragement. Consider keeping a gratitude journal to write down these moments and express your gratitude. You can also share your appreciation directly with the person who showed kindness to you, letting them know how their actions made a positive impact. Remember, by recognizing and appreciating acts of kindness, you inspire more kindness to flourish.

prompt: What are the main uses of the Raspberry Pi?

messages.content: What are the main uses of the Raspberry Pi?

Raspberry Pi computing devices are used in desktop PCs, game servers, retro gaming machines, stop-motion and time-lapse cameras, wireless print servers, and web servers. They are also used to access FM Radio stations, in weather monitoring, and used to consume media. Smart-home devices, robots and robot controllers, and AI-driven cameras are also used prominently by the Raspberry Pi.

prompt: Write me a casual letter from a son catching up with his mother. Give a positive vibe to it.

messages.content: Write me a casual letter from a son catching up with his mother. Give a positive vibe to it.

Hey Mom,

How have you been doing lately? I know it's been a while since we last spoke. I take responsibility for that. I should be making a much greater effort to reach out to you. You're my mother, and you mean the world to me. How are the dogs doing? I know Ricky can be a handful and it's getting a little harder for you to keep up with him. I insist you let me pay for a dog walker for you so you can conserve your energy. I would hate for Ricky to do you like those dogs in the movies do where they drag their owners for at least a mile. 

Your grandkids are all doing amazing. Lisa and Rob are both in varsity sports and doing extremely well. I'm so happy you raised me the way you did. Always providing a safe space for me to talk to you about what I'm going through. I applied the same tender love and care to your grandkids, and they seem to be very open and honest with me.

Unfortunately, I have to cut this letter a little short, but I love you Mom and I'll be eagerly waiting for your response. Talk to you soon Mom, I love you.

prompt:
What point of view is this blog post written in?

Made it back to the farm yesterday afternoon to find that some of the grass has grown over a foot in two weeks. A very 'back to reality' moment.
On the boats, flights and taxis I just took, had the opportunity to ponder bubbles. Fiji isn't the bubble it was growing up. The internet, even on Tokoriki, was comparable to what I get in Tasmania. (It's possible the video streaming was even faster, actually.) Once upon a childhood, you would emerge from a Fijian holiday unsure if the wider world even existed. No news reached you. It was blissful. Nowadays, even astrology as fascism manages to reach you.
But that's not quite the bubble was pondering. I have been thinking about filter bubbles in the World Without Sin context. We think we know what filter bubbles are. Filter bubbles are when you exist in a (mostly digital) ecosystem where only 'news' that you agree with or already believe is true manages to reach you.
This is only half of what constitutes a filter bubble.
The other half -and mean half- of what reaches you is the worst possible examples of opinions you do not agree with. Gun laws, climate change, freedoms of speech. Wherever you land on them, you will only see the worst examples of the opposite opinion. This half of filter bubble creation is much worse, largely because most people are too stupid to see it. Most people, even boomer facebook, are dimly aware that they are generally only exposed to ideas they are already primed to align with. But they will still flip out -all caps, mispellings everywhere- when particularly egregious example of idiocy swims up their feed. Never mind that in almost all cases these opinions define the term 'non-representative'. This is what keeps the bubble's integrity robust.

prompt: write a story about a girl called Lynda, who had addicts as parents, that has the ability to create intricate and adventurous dreams in a world where dreams are a form of currency, but only the rich can afford to dream.

messages.content: write a story about a girl called Lynda, who had addicts as parents, that has the ability to create intricate and adventurous dreams in a world where dreams are a form of currency, but only the rich can afford to dream.

In Aethoria, the rich and the poor are split up into different hierarchical levels. The rich have the utmost Top which holds all the useful resources to have a pleasant life, while the Bottom consists of garbage scattered around the streets with hardly any light reaching the surface.

A girl named Linda lived at the Bottom, in a place called Zoid which is the lowest rank you could live in. Lynda lived every day without knowing what her next meal was going to be. She lived with her parents who were drug addicts. In a world where instant pleasures had plagued the streets, Linda saw their parents sleeping on the couch with needles in their arms. She thought to herself that she would never end up like them. 

For a few years, Linda has been experimenting with creating dreams, which were only legal to the rich and people with status. So Linda was committing a crime which was punishable by death. However, this did not stop her from wanting to escape the reality of where she lived. After spending several hours a day, skipping meals and sleep, she finally created a dream which was sought after by many wealthy clients. However Linda could not go to the Top and just sell the dream, she had to find a way around and sell it on the black market. This black market had lower prices which were a steal compared to the prices on the Top. So Linda decided to head out to the shop which hosted the black market a level above her.

Once she got to the shop, she was overwhelmed by the smell in the air. It smelt like burnt rubber mixed with mold. But Linda trodded on with the mission in mind. The shopkeeper's name was Dan. A simple name and a popular one at the Bottom that would not alert the elite authorities. Linda whispered that she had created a dream and a legendary one at that. Dan's jaw dropped and he was amazed that a little girl like Linda created a dream. He wondered about how much pain she had to go through to create such a dream. Linda was able to sell the dream to Dan. She was happy that she was able to finally leave the Bottom and venture out to live a peaceful and happy life at the Top.

prompt: What are some ways I can eliminate trash being littered in my community? I don't want to tackle this issue alone so the proposed ideas shouldn't be solo solutions I have to do by myself. FYI, I live in a condo community, within a suburban metropolitan region.

messages.content: What are some ways I can eliminate trash being littered in my community? I don't want to tackle this issue alone so the proposed ideas shouldn't be solo solutions I have to do by myself. FYI, I live in a condo community, within a suburban metropolitan region.

Trash littered within a community is unpleasant and can be hard to prevent if the culprits are unknown. Here are some ways to prevent trash from being littered in your community.

1) Engage the HOA
HOA groups often create and enforce policies for the residential communities they manage. Most likely, you are not the only resident observing the trash being littered around your neighborhood and there is a high chance that other neighbors share the discontent. If your townhouse community has an HOA, bringing this issue to their attention at the next HOA meeting may be a good way to start. With enough support from other residents and approval from the HOA board, guidelines can be set restricting any trash to be littered. HOA often also have the power, written into the contractual agreements signed by residents before move-in, to enforce rules they set. Penalties for residents refusing to comply with rules may range from thousands of dollars in fees to eviction. If new HOA rules making improper disposal of trash can be set, then residents will have to eventually comply, assuming the root cause is from within the community. HOAs may even help lead preventative strategies attempting to proactively address the problem. Some strategies include the installation of waste baskets for general use, increasing the frequency of waste management services, installing street signs, and/or employing third-party street cleaning services. 

2) Establish a Neighborhood Watch Group
A neighborhood watch, also called a crime watch is an organized group of civilians devoted to crime and vandalism prevention within a neighborhood, including littering. Similar to HOA organizations, members of watch groups are often intrinsically motivated to maintain a clean neighborhood and share the same common goals. Neighborhood watch groups can be as informal or formal as one would like, although informal methods may be easier to start if your community does not have such a group in place already. Typically, informal watch groups involve select community residents patrolling and monitoring the community looking out for any suspicious activity, crime, or other behavior breaking rules. A schedule is usually shared between volunteers listing out availabilities, procedures in case of emergencies, and contact information, including local law enforcement. Having an active neighborhood watch group monitoring the community will likely deter the culprits. Although the initial purpose of starting a watch group may be to catch and deter litterers, it is possible that the group also inadvertently encounters more serious and dangerous criminals who have gone unnoticed in the past. Depending on the danger of the threats, and if the watch group volunteers are inexperienced or untrained in handling more threatening situations, then risks can quickly escalate beyond what was anticipated. Therefore, the safety of the volunteers within the group is an important concern and should remain a high priority. 

3) Contact local law enforcement
Law enforcement will likely be able to assist in preventing trash to be littered in your community. Law enforcement is a public service and it can be argued that trash is impeding the well-being of the local public. A big advantage of involving law enforcement over creating a local neighborhood watch group is that the former has extensive experience and training in dealing with a wide range of threats, while the latter may not. For example, if the litterers also coincidentally happen to be wanted fugitives then law enforcement would be prepared to apprehend the criminals safely away from the community residents. Another advantage of involving law enforcement to eliminate trash being littered in your community is that they can adjust their levels of engagement depending on the severity of the issues. If the trash being littered is largely immaterial or non-threatening, then they may elect to install street signs warning culprits of the consequences of littering or occasionally patrol the street in marked police cars. Law enforcement may even leave a marked police car in plain sight within the community since the sight of a police car is known to reduce the chances of criminal activity in most cases. However, if trash being littered is significantly harming the residents (e.g., hazardous materials, food waste, heavy items, etc.), then law enforcement will likely elect to increase their engagement and may even dedicate an officer present at all times. As illustrated, some of the benefits of contacting law enforcement are the flexibility of engagement, the depth of their expertise, and nearly unlimited resources in combatting the littering issue.

prompt: Write me an engaging twitter thread on the basics of financial planning for freelancers.

messages.content: Write me an engaging twitter thread on the basics of financial planning for freelancers.

Tweet 1:
Financial planning for freelancers is vital to career success. Irregular income, lack of employment benefits, and ever-changing industries are all reasons freelancers should prepare for the future.

In this thread, we will go over some steps you can take.

Tweet 2:
Set financial goals.  Setting financial goals allows freelancers clarity on what they are working towards. Without financial goals, freelancers can lose track of what is essential for long-term financial security. Goals serve as a constant reminder.

Tweet 3:
Set a realistic budget. Once you have your goals in place, the next step is to produce a budget that keeps you living within your means. You can ensure your budget is realistic by using your minimum income level to combat the nature of irregular income. 

Tweet 4:
Build an emergency fund.  An emergency fund is pivotal to your security as a freelancer. Clients come and go, and work can dry up quickly. Protecting against this can be the difference between a successful freelancer and one who finds themselves in debt. 

Tweet 5:
Retirement plan. Not having a contract with clients means freelancers do not get the benefits of a company pension. This means freelancers must take action and create a retirement plan themselves. A versatile portfolio with regular contributions is easy enough to set up!

Tweet 6:
Q&A 
I hope you all enjoyed this thread. If there are any questions you would like to ask, just hit me up in the comments or message me privately. I am happy to explain anything in further detail.

prompt:
Summarize by providing four ways a person with vertigo can use self-care for treatment. 

Self care

Depending on what's causing your vertigo, there may be things you can do yourself to help relieve your symptoms. Your GP or the specialist treating you may advise you to:

    do simple exercises to correct your symptoms
    sleep with your head slightly raised on two or more pillows
    get up slowly when getting out of bed and sit on the edge of the bed for a minute or so before standing
    avoid bending down to pick up items
    avoid extending your neck – for example, while reaching up to a high shelf
    move your head carefully and slowly during daily activities
    do exercises that trigger your vertigo, so your brain gets used to it and reduces the symptoms (do these only after making sure you won't fall, and have support if needed)

messages.content:
Summarize by providing four ways a person with vertigo can use self-care for treatment. 

Self care

Depending on what's causing your vertigo, there may be things you can do yourself to help relieve your symptoms. Your GP or the specialist treating you may advise you to:

    do simple exercises to correct your symptoms
    sleep with your head slightly raised on two or more pillows
    get up slowly when getting out of bed and sit on the edge of the bed for a minute or so before standing
    avoid bending down to pick up items
    avoid extending your neck – for example, while reaching up to a high shelf
    move your head carefully and slowly during daily activities
    do exercises that trigger your vertigo, so your brain gets used to it and reduces the symptoms (do these only after making sure you won't fall, and have support if needed)

Self-care tactics that can provide treatment for vertigo include: 

* Getting up slowly when getting out of bed and sitting on the edge of the bed for a while before standing
* Sleeping with your head slightly raised by using extra pillows or an adjustable bed 
* Moving your head carefully and slowly while performing daily activities 
* Avoiding bending at your hips to pick something up

These are only suggestions. If you are suffering from vertigo, the best thing you can do is consult with your primary care physician or a doctor. They can help you understand, and come up with a viable treatment plan that works for you.

prompt: I need a new music artist to listen to. I like chill, indie music with lots of jazz roots. Lo-fi is nice too. Thoughts?

messages.content: I need a new music artist to listen to. I like chill, indie music with lots of jazz roots. Lo-fi is nice too. Thoughts?

•	Norah Jones: Best known for her 2002 hit “Don’t Know Why,” this artist has produced numerous songs, most of which are driven by her jazz club-style voice. Though her tones can sometimes stray into country style, there are undeniable jazz tones present, nevertheless.
•	Rex Orange County: This up-and-coming alternative artist blends jazz and pop with a series of complex chords on top of a relatively simple (yet captivating) rhythmic structure.
•	Disclosure: Best known for their hit song “Latch” featuring pop artist Sam Smith, Disclosure brings jazz into the electronic music space building off their predecessor, Daft Punk. Their songs offer unique and entrancing chords and rhythmic structure.

prompt:
Write each sentence of the article with a question. Put the answer after the question in parentheses. Number each question/answer.

A medieval coin was found in a field in Sluskow, Poland, in 1935. Several decades later, local archaeologist Adam Kędzierski decided to see if there could be more. To his delight, he unearthed a trove of over 6000 pieces of medieval treasure in early 2021.

The hoard, estimated to be more than 900 years old, had been stashed inside linen pouches and buried in a pot. The treasure included Czech, Danish, Hungarian, and German coins, plus a number of jeweled rings. One of the gold rings was inscribed in Cyrillic with the words, “Lord, may you help your servant Maria.” Kędzierski speculated that this ring could have belonged to a local princess, pointing the way for future research on the tantalizing trove.
