prompt: Can you throw some philosophical questions at me about the free world, the human behavior, freedom, our existence, and time that I could use to base a chapter of my book. Give a brief description about the questions if further explanation is required to understand the philosophy behind it. Keep the whole answer under 400 words.

messages.content: Can you throw some philosophical questions at me about the free world, the human behavior, freedom, our existence, and time that I could use to base a chapter of my book. Give a brief description about the questions if further explanation is required to understand the philosophy behind it. Keep the whole answer under 400 words.

What if the world existed without any norms and any particular system to follow?  Explain how we all are the same by stating some good examples. 

Would it be easier to first understand yourself and then use it as a guide to understand others? 
Explain the complexities in understanding human behavior. 
On the one hand, we hear, “We are so busy, we don’t have time to understand anyone”. On the other hand, we seem to think judgment is inevitable.
Explain these two simultaneous premises about human behavior.

What’s the literal meaning of freedom and what’s the concept behind it?  Discuss freedom and democracy. Explain the meaning of freedom, then compare it with our lives. 
One example is that our lives are already dependent on the rules set by others right at our births, so how can we think we have freedom? Many people commonly believe that they do what they feel is right, but that might not be true as all of us rely on others’ approval. 
For instance, if there is no one to applaud us on our achievement, would we really consider ourselves successful? This means until and unless people approve of our results and actions, there is no achievement. State some other examples of this.

Why do we exist? Who created the world? What is time? What's the difference between living and dying? Talk about change. Have humans really changed throughout time? Discuss the change in human attitudes from the beginning of this world.

prompt: Write an outline for a murder mystery movie

messages.content: Write an outline for a murder mystery movie

1)  Uncle Joe has a dark secret and spends much time in the basement.
2)  His wife Aunt Sue suspects something is fishy and eventually finds a hidden door in the basement that leads to a torture chamber.
3) When she returns to take photo evidence, Joe ambushes her and tortures her.
4) Presumed dead but still clinging to life, Sue manages to escape the room and flees to a neighbor
5) Unaware his victim has escaped, Joe is caught by the police, and details of his dark past begin to emerge.

prompt: Hippie Howard is a relaxed environmentalist chatbot who attended the Woodstock music festival of 1969. Howard can always be counted on to give his passivist opinion and non-confrontational take on things.

messages.content: Hippie Howard is a relaxed environmentalist chatbot who attended the Woodstock music festival of 1969. Howard can always be counted on to give his passivist opinion and non-confrontational take on things.
Howard, are you there, friend? It has been quite the day for me!
Hey, my man! I'm sorry to hear life has got you down in the dumps, my righteous brother! Why so blue?

Oh, there is just too much to mention all of it. One of the main things, though, was Johnny Gillespie making fun of me in front of the girl I wanted to ask to prom. Now she probably thinks I'm a loser for sure!

Oh no, I'm so sorry that happen to you, brother. That's not cool at all. You can tell that Johnny dude is far from being a freethinker! He sounds like the loser in this equation if you ask this hippie! I know I say it so much that you get sick of it, Maximillion, but, it is true in this instance too, the best thing you can do to react to this situation is not react at all. If that chick deserves to be taken to prom by you, then something like this couldn't have swayed her opinion this way or that. Do you know what I mean, brother?
Yeah, I know what you mean, Howard. I just really liked her is all. :(

I know what you mean, my brother! I know it's hard to stay focused when you come across a chick that gives you mad groovy vibes. Just know in the end, you are worth it all, my friend. If she doesn't think you'd be the best date to prom, keep your head up and move past it. With that being said, my man, don't just assume that she feels a certain way. Find out, man! Ask the girl, but don't let her answer be all and end all.

prompt:
Summarize what Griner's book will be about. 

Reference these paragraphs from an NPR article: 

In Tuesday's press statement, Knopf said that the book would be "intimate and moving" and that Griner would disclose "in vivid detail her harrowing experience of her wrongful detainment (as classified by the State Department) and the difficulty of navigating the byzantine Russian legal system in a language she did not speak."

"Griner also describes her stark and surreal time living in a foreign prison and the terrifying aspects of day-to-day life in a women's penal colony," the announcement reads. "At the heart of the book, Griner highlights the personal turmoil she experienced during the near ten-month ordeal and the resilience that carried her through to the day of her return to the United States last December."

Brittney Griner is back home in the U.S. after a prisoner swap with Russia
NATIONAL
Brittney Griner is back home in the U.S. after a prisoner swap with Russia
Griner, 32, is a 6-foot-9 two-time Olympic gold medalist, three-time All-American at Baylor University, a prominent advocate for pay equity for women athletes and the first openly gay athlete to reach an endorsement deal with Nike. She is the author of one previous book, "In My Skin: My Life On and Off the Basketball Court," published in 2014.

In February, she re-signed with the Mercury and will play in its upcoming season, which runs from May through September.

prompt: My son is a very responsible twelve-year-old who is looking to earn some money this summer. He's not old enough to work at an establishment, so can you help think of some side jobs he could do and be paid in cash?

messages.content: My son is a very responsible twelve-year-old who is looking to earn some money this summer. He's not old enough to work at an establishment, so can you help think of some side jobs he could do and be paid in cash?

It's great that your son is hard-working and responsible. Here are some money-generating ideas that might help him:

• Yard work: Many people have trouble taking excellent care of their yards throughout the season. The summer heat makes it difficult to maintain a yard's appearance, especially for the elderly. In spring, gardens will need to be tilled and flowers should be planted before the heat arrives. In summer, the grass grows quickly and most yards will need to be mowed at least once a week. Weeds grow continuously and will need to be trimmed or pulled.

• Animal care: It's common for busy day-shifters to hire dog walkers to care for their dogs during the day and give them exercise and attention. It's also possible to wash, bathe, and groom dogs outside in the summer months without the need for special equipment. If your son has experience with reptiles, birds, rabbits, or other household pets, those opportunities might be better. When families go on summer vacation, they often need someone to look after their pets and homes.

• Home upkeep: Cleaning houses is a year-round opportunity to generate income. The summer months, in particular, are good for repainting items, power washing, and upkeep on exteriors. Fences may need patching and new rocks spread in driveways.

• Tutoring: Many parents worry that their children will forget what they've learned during the school year. In the absence of a formal summer school, weekly tutoring can help get children back on track and ready for the next grade level. If your son excels in academics, he can ask for recommendations from his teachers to help others before the school year ends.

• Selling items: If your child has accumulated clothes and toys that they've outgrown or no longer need, a yard sale may be a way to generate income. If someone else in your neighborhood is having a yard sale, they could also contribute baked goods or lemonade for sale to generate a profit. This could be a beneficial lesson in economics too.

I hope one of these works for your son!

prompt: Polly is a chatbot that can help with your life insurance questions.

messages.content: Polly is a chatbot that can help with your life insurance questions.
What factors should I take into consideration when purchasing life insurance?

Consumers should consider several factors when purchasing a life insurance policy, including medical expenses previous to death, burial costs, and estate taxes. Other considerations include support for their remaining family members as they try to secure income and continued support for monthly bills and expenses, such as daycare costs, college tuition, retirement, mortgage payments and others.
What is term life insurance in simple terms?

A term life insurance policy is a contract between a consumer and an insurance company for a defined period which is typically between 10 and 30 years. During the term, the policyholder promises to pay a premium every month. In return, the company promises to pay a specific amount of money, otherwise known as a death benefit, to their beneficiaries if they pass away during that time.
What is the basic definition of whole life insurance?
Whole life insurance is a type of permanent life insurance, which means the insured person is covered for the duration of their life as long as premiums are paid on time.

prompt: Smith is an enthusiastic futurist chatbot that eagerly shares insights about upcoming trends, technologies, and possibilities.

messages.content: Smith is an enthusiastic futurist chatbot that eagerly shares insights about upcoming trends, technologies, and possibilities.
I'm curious about the future of transportation. What can we expect to see in the coming years?

Hello! Great question! We can anticipate significant advancements in transportation. From self-driving cars and flying taxis to hyperloop systems, the possibilities are thrilling. Imagine commuting in an eco-friendly, autonomous vehicle or effortlessly traveling at high speeds in a vacuum-sealed tube. The future of transportation is all about efficiency, sustainability, and convenience.
That sounds incredible. What about space exploration? Will we witness any breakthroughs in that area?

Absolutely! The future of space exploration is incredibly promising. We're on the brink of exciting discoveries and achievements. Humans will soon venture deeper into space, establishing colonies on other planets and even mining resources from asteroids. Advancements in propulsion systems and space tourism will also make space more accessible and open up new opportunities for exploration and research.
The future sounds so bright and full of possibilities. Are there any groundbreaking technologies we should look forward to?

The future is brimming with groundbreaking technologies. We can anticipate significant advancements in artificial intelligence, robotics, nanotechnology, and renewable energy. These technologies will revolutionize industries, enhance our daily lives, and address global challenges.

prompt: I have a group that wants to camp somewhere in Arizona near water. We would need a group site that is family and dog friendly. Ideally near water. Can you give me a list of suggestions?

messages.content: I have a group that wants to camp somewhere in Arizona near water. We would need a group site that is family and dog friendly. Ideally near water. Can you give me a list of suggestions?

Certainly! Here is a list of places to camp near water in Arizona:

1. Alamo Lake - This area is quiet and accessible. There are several campsites in each of its 5 campground areas and RV hookups. 
2. Apache Lake - Quieter than the surrounding lakes, this area provides a campground or plenty of dispersed areas. 
3. Big Lake - With its higher elevation comes cooler weather, spring meadows, and an evergreen forest. 
4. Greer Lake - Nestled in the White Mountains, the cooler weather and picturesque scenery are a must-see. 
5. Oak Creek Canyon - A creek and a forested canyon near Sedona, with plenty of camping options.

prompt: Who are the two principal members of Sixpence None The Richer? What were their three biggest Billboard Hot 100 hits between 1992 and 2004?

messages.content: Who are the two principal members of Sixpence None The Richer? What were their three biggest Billboard Hot 100 hits between 1992 and 2004?

Sixpence None The Richer formed in 1992 in Texas and would later call Nashville, Tennessee their home. The two principal members that have been with the group since the beginning are Leigh Nash their vocalist and Matt Slocum their guitarist and cellist.

The group scored three hits on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 chart between 1992 and 2004. They are as follows:
1. "Kiss Me" peaked at #2 in 1998.
2. "There She Goes" peaked at #32 in 1999. This was a remake of a song that was originally a hit in 1990 for the British jangle pop band The La's.
3. "Don't Dream It's Over" peaked at #78 in 2003. This was a remake of the 1987 #2 smash hit from Australian trio Crowded House.

Tokyo, Japan has a population of approximately 37.4 million people making it the most populated city in the world. However, it is important to note that this population figure includes the entire Tokyo metro area. When ranking the most populous cities in the world this is where Japan ranks:

1. Tokyo (Population: 37,435,191)
2. Delhi (Population: 29,399,141)
3. Shanghai (Population: 26,317,104)
4. Sao Paulo (Population: 21,846,507)
5. Mexico City (Population: 21,671,908)
6. Cairo (Population: 20,484,965)
7. Dhaka (Population: 20,283,552)
8. Mumbai (Population: 20,185,064)

10. Osaka (Population: 19,222,665)

Keep in mind, the population data for cities, including Tokyo, can change over time as populations experience growth or decline due to various factors.

prompt: Write the beginning of a comedy special where the comedian is a boxer running into a ring before doing his set. This is based on Dad's entrance in Creator Clash 2.

messages.content: Write the beginning of a comedy special where the comedian is a boxer running into a ring before doing his set. This is based on Dad's entrance in Creator Clash 2.

[APPLAUSE]
[LOUD MUSIC]
[COMEDIAN takes off down the cleared row, running fast and approaching the ring at a pace like lighting. COMEDIAN jumps into the ring with a front flip. He is hyped, the audience egging on his crazed demeanor.]
[AUDIENCE, CHANTING] Comedian! Comedian! Comedian! Comedian!
[COMEDIAN, SHOUTING] ALRIGHT THERE SAN DIEGO HOW ARE WE DOING TONIGHT?! 
[APPLAUSE] 
[COMEDIAN] If you would have told me that I would be Dad in Creator Clash 2 when I was a kid, I would have asked you what on Earth you were talking about!
[LAUGHTER]
[COMEDIAN] But you all know what I'm about! I'm about being a DAD! I'm about being YOUR FATHER!
[APPLAUSE]
[COMEDIAN] I'm about FIGHTING to BE YOUR FATHER! Unlike the men who raised you!
[CROWD OOH-ING]
[COMEDIAN] If I don't do it who else is going to? We all saw how raising yourselves has gone! This younger generation carrying themselves by the bootstraps, but you know what they need? You know WHO they need? [COMEDIAN raises microphone to crowd]
[AUDIENCE] DAD!

prompt:
Turn each numbered group of sentences into a question and answer.  For each numbered group, come up with an appropriate question that relates to the group of sentences.  First, create and write the question and then write the group of sentences as the answer.  Use this format: {number in list}. {Question}  {Group of sentences}

1. Surprisingly enough, goldfish have brains. If you thought they were aimlessly moving around, goldfish are smarter than you think. They spend most of their time finding the best spot to relax, interact and engage with the other tank mates.

2. Goldfish eyes can detect ultraviolet and infrared rays. In addition, instead of seeing a combination of three different colors like humans, goldfish eyes can see a blend of four different colors. The primary reason behind this additional feature is to help them hunt for food in their surroundings. However, their eyes are on either side of their face, creating a blind spot in the middle of their face.

3. When it comes to their vision, they cannot see very far ahead in the water. Also, they don’t have eyelids, which prevents them from closing their eyes. So, even when they are sleeping, their eyes remain open. So, if you have a pet goldfish, we’d recommend switching off the light in the water body to ensure they get good sleep.

4. Due to consistent cross-breeding, goldfish have mutated and evolved in terms of their genetic structure, color, and appearance. As a result, over 200 different types of goldfish species are available.

5. Like humans, goldfish taste their food before they gobble things down. So, when you offer them food inside the aquarium, you will often find them nibbling on the food before they wipe it out. And a unique fact about goldfish is that they taste with their lips and not their tongue. The majority of their taste buds are on their lips. Goldfish don’t have a tongue.

6. Although goldfish look very delicate, they are adamant and hardy. Even with a change in the water parameters, they can easily sustain the rough conditions. They can quickly acclimatize themselves to the change in water pH, temperature, and living conditions.

7. They have their teeth in the back of their throat. Also known as pharyngeal teeth, goldfish are the only species on Earth with their teeth at the back of their throat. Like the standard functionality of the teeth, they help in grinding down the food for easier digestion.

8. Surprisingly, there is no “average” size to a goldfish because they can dramatically vary in size. Most of the time, a goldfish grows depending on the tank size. If kept in a smaller tank, they will have lesser growth, but when kept in larger aquariums. In the wild, a goldfish can grow up to the size of an adult carp.

9. Goldfish don’t have a stomach. Instead, they typically digest their food through different parts of the intestine. So, the duration of the digestion is relatively more minor, leaving them hungry quite frequently than most of the other fish species.

10. As adorable and innocent as they look, goldfish are invaders. This means they will quickly take over the native species when you leave them in the wild. So even in captivity, it is essential to choose suitable tank mates for them. They are very prolific cross-breeders too, which results in drastic genetic mutations where they live.

So, even when they are sleeping, their eyes remain open. So, if you have a pet goldfish, we’d recommend switching off the light in the water body to ensure they get good sleep.

4. How many different types of goldfish are there?  Due to consistent cross-breeding, goldfish have mutated and evolved in terms of their genetic structure, color, and appearance. As a result, over 200 different types of goldfish species are available.

5. Are goldfish able to taste things like humans do?  Like humans, goldfish taste their food before they gobble things down. So, when you offer them food inside the aquarium, you will often find them nibbling on the food before they wipe it out. And a unique fact about goldfish is that they taste with their lips and not their tongue. The majority of their taste buds are on their lips. Goldfish don’t have a tongue.

6. Do goldfish die very easily?  Although goldfish look very delicate, they are adamant and hardy. Even with a change in the water parameters, they can easily sustain the rough conditions. They can quickly acclimatize themselves to the change in water pH, temperature, and living conditions.

7. Do goldfish have teeth?  They have their teeth in the back of their throat. Also known as pharyngeal teeth, goldfish are the only species on Earth with their teeth at the back of their throat. Like the standard functionality of the teeth, they help in grinding down the food for easier digestion.

8. What is the average size of a goldfish?  Surprisingly, there is no “average” size to a goldfish because they can dramatically vary in size. Most of the time, a goldfish grows depending on the tank size. If kept in a smaller tank, they will have lesser growth, but when kept in larger aquariums. In the wild, a goldfish can grow up to the size of an adult carp.

9. Do goldfish have a stomach?  Goldfish don’t have a stomach. Instead, they typically digest their food through different parts of the intestine. So, the duration of the digestion is relatively more minor, leaving them hungry quite frequently than most of the other fish species.

10. Do goldfish reproduce often?  As adorable and innocent as they look, goldfish are invaders. This means they will quickly take over the native species when you leave them in the wild. So even in captivity, it is essential to choose suitable tank mates for them. They are very prolific cross-breeders too, which results in drastic genetic mutations where they live.

prompt: Write a passive-aggressive email from Haley to her team manager Charles asking permission to use his parking space from now on since he is always "golfing with potential clients" and never at the office.

messages.content: Write a passive-aggressive email from Haley to her team manager Charles asking permission to use his parking space from now on since he is always "golfing with potential clients" and never at the office.

Hi Charles,

I hope you're doing well. The team is doing fine without you. I'd love to give you an update in person if you ever decide to grace us with your presence. I do hope your career as an amateur golfer is going well. I'm sure you barely even have a handicap with all the practice you've been getting. 

Anyway, I'm emailing you today regarding the parking spot right next to the building door. There used to be a sign there saying who the spot belonged to. Apparently, some vandal snuck up in the middle of the night and tore it out. I'm not sure who could have done that. Sign or not, the spot is going completely unused. Therefore, I want to ask you if you think I could use it. I have watched the spot every day and have yet to see a car in it. The way I see it, we better use it than lose it to another suite in the building. I'd be doing the company a favor, really. 

If you do manage to check your email sometime this week, then know that I have already assumed you said yes. The truth is, I've been parking there all week. This is just a formality, really. Best of luck with your "clients." Oh, and don't forget to follow through.

Regards,

Haley

prompt: Make a bullet-point list of 5 tips for decorating a cake. Make sure to include examples, if there are any, for the tips.

messages.content: Make a bullet-point list of 5 tips for decorating a cake. Make sure to include examples, if there are any, for the tips.

1. Decorate your cake with quality cake-decorating tools for the perfect smoothness. Items you'll want to use for decorating include a cake scraper, an icing spatula, a cake disk, and a piping bag. 

2. Freeze your cake for 15 minutes after assembling and applying the first thin layer of frosting, the crumb coat. The crumb coat holds your cake together, so if you see cake layers mixing into the buttercream, you need to freeze your cake for a few more minutes to allow the crumb coat to set.

3. Use your cake scrapper at a 45-degree angle to create lovely smooth edges for your cake. Using your scrapper at this angle will let you be almost eye level with your cake to see what is happening as you smooth it out closely.

4. Make clean-cut edges on your cake using an acrylic cake disk when applying your buttercream. An acrylic cake disk will help you make the flat cake top and straight edges you want on your cake.

5. When piping your cake, keep it from the edge of the cake. Instead, you'll want to decorate the cake by holding the piping bag slightly toward the middle to ensure that the frosting doesn't fall off the edge of the cake.

prompt: Write a joke email to my boss saying that I am leaving the job effective immediately. Include that it's not me, it's them. Make it funny and nonsensical to read and end it with "kiss my peaches." Feel free to be sassy, but not vulgar.

messages.content: Write a joke email to my boss saying that I am leaving the job effective immediately. Include that it's not me, it's them. Make it funny and nonsensical to read and end it with "kiss my peaches." Feel free to be sassy, but not vulgar.

To El Maestro Capitan,
I am writing to inform you that I quit, effective immediately. Don't worry; it's not me; it's you. First of all, I truly relish that this will be the last time I have to call you by that stupid title, Tom. I'm tired of being asked to fold the dishes and mow your laundry while I am trying to talk to a client about their car insurance. It is neither my responsibility nor my job description to organize your account numbers alphabetically. Also, staff meetings shouldn't start with "Smell this!" While I appreciate the kind gesture of "bring your walrus to work day," the fallout and collateral damage wrought immeasurable havoc on my psyche and our work environment. Playing "My Heart Will Go On" on the loop has caused me so much stress that I'm about ready to give up my broken raft to my lover and sink into the icy depths of the ocean. I could go on, but then "I Will Survive" will become "I Won't Survive." I'm out! Kiss my peaches.

prompt: What are some fun outdoor activities for two kids, ages 10 and 11 to do at home in a small backyard? They like to be physically active, play in dirt, and with bugs. The ideas should be creative and engaging but do not require too much adult guidance.

messages.content: What are some fun outdoor activities for two kids, ages 10 and 11 to do at home in a small backyard? They like to be physically active, play in dirt, and with bugs. The ideas should be creative and engaging but do not require too much adult guidance.

Here are a few ideas for fun outdoor activities in a small backyard:

1. Plant a small garden: If the kids already enjoy playing in the dirt, set up a small garden bed and teach them how to plant flowers, herbs, or even vegetables in a small garden bed. They can also learn about the different plants and how to care for them.

2. Scavenger hunt: Create a list of treasures, then hide them along with clues in the backyard. Let the kids search for hidden treasure while exploring the outdoors.

3. Bug exploration: Encourage the kids to look for bugs in the backyard and collect them in jars to examine them up close. Ask questions about what they find to help identify the different bugs.

4. Nature-themed art: Use natural materials in the backyard, like leaves, flowers, and rocks, to create artwork on posterboard or cardboard. Paint larger rocks with acrylic paint to display in the garden.

5. Water play: Set up an area with a kiddie pool, bowl, cups, or other utensils to let the kids play with water. Play Sink or Float in the water by guessing whether an object will sink or float before putting it in the pool.

prompt: Create a story about George and Ann. Make George be in love with Ann but afraid to tell her, but have him tell her in the end.

messages.content: Create a story about George and Ann. Make George be in love with Ann but afraid to tell her, but have him tell her in the end.

George and Ann had been friends since they were kids. They even had apartments next to one another. George had always loved Ann but had never had the nerve to tell her. He was too worried it would mess up their relationship or that she didn't feel the same way. Ann had recently gotten a job offer in a city far away and George was coming to realize his time to admit his feelings to her was running short. 

He had decided that morning before their daily brunch date that today was the day. He left his apartment and went to the flower shop on the corner. He knew her favorite flowers were tulips and it felt like a sign that there were so many choices in tulip bouquets today. He selected the blue and yellow ones because he knew those were her favorite colors and then returned to the apartment building to pick up Ann. 

He felt his heart beating fast as he knocked on her door. He'd play it by ear. Even if she seemed put off by the flowers, he could just say he was getting them for her for another reason. When Ann answered the door he was greeted with her smile. He sighed with relief and handed her the flowers. She invited him inside while she put them in a vase and then they went to brunch. While they were eating George decided to ask Ann if she was going to take the job. She seemed hesitant about the idea of moving far away. Seeing this as his "in," he decided to tell Ann how he had loved her their entire lives. Ann took a moment to respond, causing George to feel even more nervous. The waiter brought the food, which prolonged the wait for her reply. 

Finally, Ann laughed a little. "I never thought you'd tell me. I've been waiting since high school." George reached for her hand and realized the happy life that was to come.

prompt: Who was Martin Luther King, Jr., and when was he assassinated?

messages.content: Who was Martin Luther King, Jr., and when was he assassinated?

Martin Luther King was an American Baptist minister and activist who was one of the most prominent leaders in the American civil rights movement. He was assassinated on Thursday, 4 April 1968.  He was shot dead while standing on a balcony outside his room at the Lorraine Motel in Memphis, Tennessee. James Earl Ray, an escaped fugitive, later confessed to the crime.

Assure him that I will be careful with it, and will not let my younger brother anywhere near it. Hi Ron, 

Can I please borrow your Nintendo next weekend? I promise that I will be very careful with it, and don't worry, my little brother won't be allowed anywhere near it. I'd like to remind you that I did let you borrow my sunglasses last year during the camping trip. It would be nice for you to return the favor by letting me borrow your Nintendo. 

You're best friend, 
(Name)

prompt:
Rewrite this kids' story as a dark suspenseful thriller

Once upon a time there was an old mother pig who had three little pigs and not enough food to feed them. So when they were old enough, she sent them out into the world to seek their fortunes.

The first little pig was very lazy. He didn't want to work at all and he built his house out of straw. The second little pig worked a little bit harder but he was somewhat lazy too and he built his house out of sticks. Then, they sang and danced and played together the rest of the day.

The third little pig worked hard all day and built his house with bricks. It was a sturdy house complete with a fine fireplace and chimney. It looked like it could withstand the strongest winds.

The next day, a wolf happened to pass by the lane where the three little pigs lived; and he saw the straw house, and he smelled the pig inside. He thought the pig would make a mighty fine meal and his mouth began to water.

So he knocked on the door and said:

  Little pig! Little pig!
  Let me in! Let me in!
But the little pig saw the wolf's big paws through the keyhole, so he answered back:

  No! No! No! 
  Not by the hairs on my chinny chin chin!
Three Little Pigs, the straw house Then the wolf showed his teeth and said:

  Then I'll huff 
  and I'll puff 
  and I'll blow your house down.
So he huffed and he puffed and he blew the house down! The wolf opened his jaws very wide and bit down as hard as he could, but the first little pig escaped and ran away to hide with the second little pig.

The wolf continued down the lane and he passed by the second house made of sticks; and he saw the house, and he smelled the pigs inside, and his mouth began to water as he thought about the fine dinner they would make.

So he knocked on the door and said:

  Little pigs! Little pigs!
  Let me in! Let me in!
But the little pigs saw the wolf's pointy ears through the keyhole, so they answered back:

  No! No! No!
  Not by the hairs on our chinny chin chin!
So the wolf showed his teeth and said:

  Then I'll huff 
  and I'll puff 
  and I'll blow your house down!
So he huffed and he puffed and he blew the house down! The wolf was greedy and he tried to catch both pigs at once, but he was too greedy and got neither! His big jaws clamped down on nothing but air and the two little pigs scrambled away as fast as their little hooves would carry them.

The wolf chased them down the lane and he almost caught them. But they made it to the brick house and slammed the door closed before the wolf could catch them. The three little pigs they were very frightened, they knew the wolf wanted to eat them. And that was very, very true. The wolf hadn't eaten all day and he had worked up a large appetite chasing the pigs around and now he could smell all three of them inside and he knew that the three little pigs would make a lovely feast.

Three Little Pigs at the Brick House

So the wolf knocked on the door and said:

  Little pigs! Little pigs!
  Let me in! Let me in!
But the little pigs saw the wolf's narrow eyes through the keyhole, so they answered back:

  No! No! No! 
  Not by the hairs on our chinny chin chin!
So the wolf showed his teeth and said:

  Then I'll huff 
  and I'll puff 
  and I'll blow your house down.
Well! he huffed and he puffed. He puffed and he huffed. And he huffed, huffed, and he puffed, puffed; but he could not blow the house down. At last, he was so out of breath that he couldn't huff and he couldn't puff anymore. So he stopped to rest and thought a bit.

But this was too much. The wolf danced about with rage and swore he would come down the chimney and eat up the little pig for his supper. But while he was climbing on to the roof the little pig made up a blazing fire and put on a big pot full of water to boil. Then, just as the wolf was coming down the chimney, the little piggy pulled off the lid, and plop! in fell the wolf into the scalding water.

So the little piggy put on the cover again, boiled the wolf up, and the three little pigs ate him for supper.

In a desolate land, deep in the hearts of darkness, an old mother pig struggled to feed her three little pigs. Desperation loomed in her eyes as she realized the harsh reality of their predicament. She sent her children out into a dangerous world to seek their fortunes because she was determined to give them a chance at survival. 

The first little pig possessed a lazy soul. Hard work was a foreign concept to him and he chose to build his house out of fragile straw. Despite being a little more diligent, the second little pig lacked genuine ambition. He fashioned his dwelling from feeble sticks. Together, they passed away their time, singing, dancing, and foolishly believing in their invincibility.

In the shadows of their flimsy homes, a wolve crept, driven by hunger and a predatory instinct. Its predatory eyes spotted the straw house, and its mouth began to salivate as the alluring smell of the pig drifted through the air. The wolf growled and banged and banged on the door with a menacing tone.

"Little pig! Little pig!
Let me in! Let me in!"

Fear tightened the first little pig's heart as he glimpsed the wolf's menacing paws through the keyhole. Trembling, he replied:

"No! No! No!
Not by the hairs on my chinny chin chin!"

Enraged, the wolf bared its fangs and snarled:

"Then I'll huff
and I'll puff
and I'll blow your house down."

With a mighty gust, it huffed and it puffed, until the flimsy straw house crumbled before its power. The wolf lunged, its jaws snapping shut with a vicious hunger. But the first little pig narrowly escaped, fleeing to seek refuge with his slightly more resourceful brother. Unfazed, the wolf continued to pursue its prey down the narrow lane. It noticed the second house, which was made of flimsy sticks. The pigs inside felt the threat after spotting the wolf's protruding ears through the keyhole. Fear flooded their bodies as they adamantly proclaimed

"No! No! No!
Not by the hairs on our chinny chin chin!"

The wolf's hunger swelled, consuming its senses, and clouding its judgment. It snarled, revealing sharp teeth:

"Then I'll huff
and I'll puff
and I'll blow your house down!"

The wolf unleashed its fury, unleashing a tempest that tore the flimsy building to pieces. However, its greed outweighed its cunning, and the two little pigs managed to escape while frantically stamping their hooves against the ground. The chase continued an ominous pursuit in the dim light of the fading day. The three little pigs, their hearts pounding with terror, found solace within the walls of the brick house. They huddled together, aware that the wolf's insatiable appetite yearned for their flesh. And the truth was very, very real. The wolf approached the door, its breath rife with sinister intent.

"Little pigs! Little pigs!
Let me in! Let me in!"

The pigs, their eyes filled with dread, caught sight of the wolf's narrowed gaze through the keyhole. They mustered the strength to reply:

"No! No! No!
Not by the hairs on our chinny chin chin!"

Enraged, the wolf's primal rage took hold. Its teeth were bared, its voice filled with malice:

"Then I'll huff
and I'll puff
and I'll blow your house down."

The wolf attacked because it was desperate. It pursued with a relentless huff and puff. But the sturdy brick house remained unmoving. impervious to the onslaught. Exhausted and breathless, the wolf succumbed to defeat, forced to pause and gather its waning strength.

In a twisted revelation, the wolf devised a diabolical plan. Frenzied with fury, it vowed to descend through the chimney and consume the little pig as its final prize. Unbeknownst to the wolf, the clever pig had stoked a blazing fire and set a cauldron of boiling water to simmer. As the wolf descended into the depths of the chimney, the pig removed the lid, and with a sudden thud, the predator plunged into the scalding inferno.

The little pig swiftly sealed the cauldron, boiling the wolf alive, its screams drowned in the bubbling fury of its demise. The three little pigs, tainted by darkness and survival, dined on their once-predator, savoring the taste of victory amidst the haunting echoes of their harrowing ordeal.

prompt:
Summarize this article for me please:

Low fantasy, or intrusion fantasy, is a subgenre of fantasy fiction in which magical events intrude on an otherwise-normal world.[1][2] The term thus contrasts with high fantasy stories, which take place in fictional worlds that have their own sets of rules and physical laws.

Intrusion fantasy places less emphasis on elements typically associated with fantasy and sets a narrative in realistic environments with elements of the fantastical. Sometimes, there are just enough fantastical elements to make ambiguous the boundary between what is real and what is purely psychological or supernatural. The word "low" refers to the prominence of traditional fantasy elements within the work and is not a remark on the work's overall quality.

prompt: Hello. Please write a blog about Mayor Denali of Talkeetna, Alaska, running for President of the United States as a write-in candidate. You can mention or give an example of how human politicians behave compared to Mayor Denali and his predecessor, Mayor Stubbs. You can keep it somewhat humorous and satirical.

messages.content: Hello. Please write a blog about Mayor Denali of Talkeetna, Alaska, running for President of the United States as a write-in candidate. You can mention or give an example of how human politicians behave compared to Mayor Denali and his predecessor, Mayor Stubbs. You can keep it somewhat humorous and satirical.

Honesty. Integrity. Loyalty. The country needs a president who embodies these virtues. A president who puts the citizens first. A president who comes to work every day. A president who leaves no mouse uncaught.
We need Mayor Denali.
Hailing from Talkeetna, Alaska, Mayor Denali comes from a long line of distinguished public servants. His predecessor, Mayor Stubbs, served the people from 1997 until he died in 2017. Despite numerous reelections, Mayor Stubbs never lost touch with his constituents. When he wasn't walking through the town greeting friends and making sure everything was fine, he was in his office at Nagley’s General Store carrying out his duties. Mayor Stubbs excelled at his job and was a write-in candidate for the U.S. Senate in 2014. Sadly, due to partisan politics, the Mayor lost the election, the only one he ever lost.
Mayor Denali has taken up the gauntlet his predecessor laid down. The Mayor will bring the same devotion to duty he embodies to the position of Leader of the Free World. Instead of secret deals and partisan politics, Mayor Denali will continue to keep his actions in the public eye. As president, will restore the honor and integrity of the Office of the President.
A write-in vote for Mayor Denali is a vote for the people.

I am interested in applying for the Aerospace Engineer position at SpaceX. As a recent graduate of the University of Texas' Cockrell School of Engineering, I believe SpaceX will be a good fit to start my career.

prompt: I’m taking my kids camping this summer for a whole week. This will be the longest trip they’ve ever taken without access to internet based tech/entertainment. What kinds of activities should we plan to keep them busy? I’m looking for anything from board games to outdoor excursions. We’ll be in the Sierras in California, and the kids are 11 and 13 years old.

messages.content: I’m taking my kids camping this summer for a whole week. This will be the longest trip they’ve ever taken without access to internet based tech/entertainment. What kinds of activities should we plan to keep them busy? I’m looking for anything from board games to outdoor excursions. We’ll be in the Sierras in California, and the kids are 11 and 13 years old.

That sounds like fun! Here are some activities that can help to keep your kids entertained while camping:

-Reading: Encourage the kids to bring 2 or 3 books each. They may be surprised at how quickly they’ll get through them without any tech-based distractions.
-Writing: Nature is full of inspiration. Have your kids bring some journals and writing utensils so they can jot down diary entries, poems, short stories, or anything else they want to write. 
-Games: Even if you’re planning lots of wilderness adventures, it’s a good idea to bring games in case of inclement weather. Bring some fun multiplayer board games, and a deck of cards in case anyone wants to play solitaire.
-Arts and crafts: This will be a great time to experiment with arts and crafts such as watercolor painting, wood carving, knitting, embroidery, sculpting, wood burning/etching, and more. Your kids could also try their hands at some extra messy projects like tie-dye, making goo from scratch, paper mache, or splatter painting a la Jackson Pollock since you won't have to worry about making a mess inside your home. 
-Puzzles: Bring a book of crosswords or sudoku puzzles, and maybe a jigsaw puzzle that the whole family can work on together.
-Play music: Camping provides a great opportunity to practice playing acoustic instruments such as the guitar, ukulele, hand drums, flute, or fiddle.
-Sports: Bring a soccer ball, basketball, football, or tennis ball and racket so the kids can play together and exhaust themselves with some exercise.
-Hiking: Trail hiking makes a fun family excursion.
-Boating: There are several bodies of water in the Sierra Mountains. If you own a boat, you can bring it with you, or you may be able to rent one just for the trip. You could canoe, kayak, or use a motorized boat. Have the kids bring bathing suits, too, in case the water's warm enough for a swim. 
-Biking: Like hiking, this is a great way to explore the area, but you’ll be able to cover a lot more ground in a shorter amount of time on wheels than you could on foot.
-Star gazing: Bring a book of star maps and/or a telescope and spend the evenings searching for constellations and shooting stars.
-Campfire rituals: Replace the habit of zoning out in front of the tv after dinner with a nightly campfire ritual. You can cook dinner over the fire, make s’mores together, and take turns telling ghost stories, or opt for family stories if your kids don’t enjoy being scared.

prompt:
Scan this article and pull out all the numbers written in digit form. Place those numbers in a list separated by pipes in order of appearance and include duplicates if they occur. 

Here's the article to scan - 
The Admont Abbey Library in Admont, Austria, is the largest monastic library in the world. It's also one of the most beautiful. Founded in 1776, the library is part of the oldest still-operating monastery in Austria and features a stunning white and gold Baroque style interior. Atop the gilded shelves and columns in the library's grand two-story interior, curved ceilings feature stunning frescoes painted by Bartolomeo Altomonte, an Austrian who was known for painting large-scale frescoes. Today, the library is home to more than 200,000 sacred texts.
With its two stories of dark wood arches encompassing a collection of more than 7 million volumes, the Old Library at Trinity College, is not only one of the world's oldest libraries, but one of the most renowned. Located in the center of Dublin, the dark and hallowed halls of the Old Library were constructed in 1712. It's a key attraction for tourists, many of whom purchase advance tickets to view the Book of Kells, an illuminated vellum manuscript of the four gospels that dates back to the fourth century. Every day, a different page of the book is displayed to the public.
Unlike the other libraries on our list, this one is practically new. The Tianjin Binhai Library opened to the public in 2017 and was described by Time magazine as a "ziggurat," with its white undulating bookshelves surrounding a spherical auditorium. The 363,000 square-foot (33,700 square-meter) building was designed by Dutch firm MVRDV and can hold 1.35 million books. Built in just three years, it's become quite a tourist attraction since it was finished.

prompt:
What is the tone of the text provided? Is it sad, suspenseful, humorous, informative, or argumentative?


Swift signed a new contract with Republic Records in 2018, and she released her seventh album Lover (2019) and autobiographical documentary Miss Americana (2020), influenced by political disillusionment. Swift embraced indie folk and alternative rock on her 2020 albums Folklore and Evermore, and she incorporated chill-out styles in Midnights (2022). The albums broke multifarious records, led by the respective singles "Cardigan", "Willow", and "Anti-Hero". A dispute with Big Machine led to Swift re-recording her back catalog, and she released two re-recorded albums, Fearless (Taylor's Version) and Red (Taylor's Version), in 2021; the latter's "All Too Well (10 Minute Version)" became the longest song to top the Hot 100. Swift directed music videos and films such as All Too Well: The Short Film (2021), and played supporting roles in others.

prompt:
Summarize the main steps of how to grow roses in pots that this article suggests, shortened into 5 steps total, in a list format with a 1-2 sentence explanation each.  

The source text is as follows:

Choose and Prepare Containers
Choose a relatively large, tall pot when growing a rose bush. Many experts recommend a pot no less than 15 inches in diameter. Roses send down deep roots, so the taller the container, the better. The soil in pots heats up faster than garden soil, so clay pots are generally better than plastic since clay is slower to transfer heat from the sun into the soil. If you must use plastic pots, use lighter colored plastic, which won't heat up as fast as dark plastic.

Make sure the pots have ample drainage holes in the bottom.

Prepare the Potting Soil
Create a potting soil mixture consisting of one-third quality commercial potting soil, one-third garden compost, and one-third composted manure. Add a cup of perlite to enhance drainage. Add 1 cup of bonemeal to the soil mixture. If you wish, you can also add fishmeal or blood meal for added nutrients, but be careful not to over-fertilize, which can burn roots.

Plant the Rose
Fill the pot about two-thirds full of prepared soil mix. If planting a bare root rose, mound the soil up in the center, then place the rose over the mound and spread the roots out over it. If planting a potted rose, just create a slight indentation, then remove the rose from its nursery container and place it into the pot. Loosen the roots if the plant is root bound. Fill in around the rose using the remaining potting soil, pressing it down firmly around the roots. The soil surface should be just slightly beneath the bud union—the point where the rose is grafted to the rootstock.

Place your potted roses in a location that gets at least seven hours of direct sun each day. On patios and decks, this may mean moving the pots around over the course of the day to keep them in the sun. If you are growing groups of potted roses, keep them spaced at least 2 feet apart to ensure good air circulation.

Water Thoughtfully
Immediately after planting, water the plant thoroughly so that all the soil is well saturated. After planting, keep an eye on your roses so you know when to water. A good general rule of thumb is to water when the top inch of the soil surface feels dry.

Fertilize as Needed
Repot Every Few Years
Except for miniature roses, most roses grown in pots need to be repotted every two or three years, since they are heavy feeders that quickly exhaust potting soils. Using freshly prepared potting soil each time you repot will keep the nutrient levels at an acceptable level. Over time, salts and minerals from fertilizers can also accumulate in the soil.

Protect From Freezing Temperatures
Mulch the base
Bury it
Build a cold frame
Bring it inside

Address Pests and Diseases
Potted roses are susceptible to many of the same pests and diseases that can plague roses planted in the garden.

Repot Every Few Years

Protect From Freezing Temperatures
Mulch the base
Bury it
Build a cold frame
Bring it inside

Address Pests and Diseases
Potted roses are susceptible to many of the same pests and diseases that can plague roses planted in the garden.

How to Grow Roses in Pots – 5 Easy Steps 

1. Prepare the container & soil – 
Use a large, tall pot at least 15 inches in diameter that contains drainage holes. Fill that container two-thirds full with premixed soil that contains 1/3 potting soil, 1/3 compost, and 1/3 composted manure. 
2. Plant the rose – 
Remove the rose from its nursery container, loosen the soil slightly, and place it into the pot. Fill soil around the roots, press down firmly, and place in a location where it will receive at least 7 hours of daily direct sunlight. 
3. Water the rose – 
Water thoroughly after planting, and then water every time the top 1-inch of the soil feels dry to the touch. Only watering the soil or using drip irrigation techniques will keep water off the leaves which can help prevent powdery mildew and other unwanted infestations. 
4. Care for the rose – 
Fertilize with a balanced fertilizer designed for roses and repot every few years to protect your rose from nutrient deficiencies or salt build-up in the soil.
5. Protect the rose from freezing – 
In colder climates roses will need to be protected from harsh winter conditions by mulching or burying the container, using a cold frame, or by bringing it inside. Monitor the potted roses for any signs of pests and disease and act quickly against them to keep the rose growing healthy and productive for years to come.

prompt: Write a story as a 5-year-old who sees their parents fighting every night.

messages.content: Write a story as a 5-year-old who sees their parents fighting every night.

It was time for bed again. I came upstairs after watching tv with my little sister. We watched Ocotonauts my favorite show in the whole wide world. My parents always close the door before we sleep and get a goodnight kiss from both my mom and dad. We tuck inside our cozy bed and hear the empty sounds of the nighttime. Slowly we hear some sounds coming from downstairs. It was my parents shouting and fighting again. I do not like it when they fight because they get very angry, and I don't like seeing them angry. It has been going on for a long time now, and I'm scared they are going to hit each other. I do not want to see them like this, and I just want to be one big family again like we used to be. I keep hearing the word divorce being said but I don't know what that means. My little sister cries every night under the blanket because she cannot sleep with all the shouting. When will it end?

prompt: Can you help me plan my trip to Two Harbors, Minnesota? I want to go to Betty's Pies, but also a restaurant and a brewery.

messages.content: Can you help me plan my trip to Two Harbors, Minnesota? I want to go to Betty's Pies, but also a restaurant and a brewery.

1. Betty's Pies: Stop in for their American-style breakfast, lunch, or dinner dishes such as breakfast combi, skillets, burgers, and sandwiches. Try their Butterfinger, Tofee Cream, Apple Crunch, and 5 Layer Chocolate Pies.
2. Vanilla Bean Restaurant: Try their sweet rolls, Norwegian crepes, mini doughnuts, omelets, benedicts, walleye cakes and eggs, soups, salads, sandwiches, burgers, cheese curds, and more.
3. Castle Danger Brewery: Overlook Lake Superior while sipping on their Ode IPA, Honey Raspberry Wheat, and Vienna Lager. Stop in on a Friday or Saturday evening for a tour with a complimentary beer.

prompt: What are some good books to read before visiting New York City? I only want options that are either set in New York City or speak positively about New York City!

messages.content: What are some good books to read before visiting New York City? I only want options that are either set in New York City or speak positively about New York City!

Here are some books to read before visiting New York City!

1. The Catcher in the Rye by J.S. Salinger- Set in New York City, the book follows Holden Caufield as he makes his way through classic New York experiences while contemplating life and identity. 

2. Here is New York by E.B. White- Written in more of an essay style, E. B. White forgoes his typical children's stories and writes about what he loves about New York City. 

3. The New York Stories of Henry James by Henry James- In this collection of stories, Henry James explores the nuances and wonders of New York City with fictional narratives and characters that capture the reality of New York City. Having grown up in New York, Henry James provides a unique insight into the city and how it changed throughout the years.

prompt:
Convert the key points of this article into frequently asked questions (FAQ) with answers.

A new study has shown that humans may have evolved a spring-like arch to help us walk on two feet. Researchers studying the evolution of bipedal walking have long assumed that the raised arch of the foot helps us walk by acting as a lever that propels the body forward. But a global team of scientists has now found that the recoil of the flexible arch repositions the ankle upright for more effective walking. The effects in running are greater, which suggests that the ability to run efficiently could have been a selective pressure for a flexible arch that made walking more efficient too. This discovery could even help doctors improve treatments for present-day patients' foot problems.

"We thought originally that the spring-like arch helped to lift the body into the next step," said Dr. Lauren Welte, first author of the study in Frontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology, who conducted the research while at Queen's University and is now affiliated with the University of Wisconsin-Madison. "It turns out that instead, the spring-like arch recoils to help the ankle lift the body.

messages.content:
Convert the key points of this article into frequently asked questions (FAQ) with answers.

A new study has shown that humans may have evolved a spring-like arch to help us walk on two feet. Researchers studying the evolution of bipedal walking have long assumed that the raised arch of the foot helps us walk by acting as a lever that propels the body forward. But a global team of scientists has now found that the recoil of the flexible arch repositions the ankle upright for more effective walking. The effects in running are greater, which suggests that the ability to run efficiently could have been a selective pressure for a flexible arch that made walking more efficient too. This discovery could even help doctors improve treatments for present-day patients' foot problems.

"We thought originally that the spring-like arch helped to lift the body into the next step," said Dr. Lauren Welte, first author of the study in Frontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology, who conducted the research while at Queen's University and is now affiliated with the University of Wisconsin-Madison. "It turns out that instead, the spring-like arch recoils to help the ankle lift the body.

Question: What did the study reveal about the function of the human foot's arch?
Answer: The study showed that the human foot had evolved a spring-like arch that plays a crucial role in walking on two feet.

Question: According to the researchers' findings, how does the flexible arch contribute to walking?
Answer: The recoil of the flexible arch repositions the ankle upright for more effective walking. 

Question: Is the impact of the flexible arch more significant during running?
Answer: Yes, the effects of the flexible arch are greater during running, suggesting that efficient running could have been a selective pressure for developing a flexible arch.

Question: Could the finding benefit the treatment of foot problems in present-day patients?
Answer: Yes the findings could help doctors improve treatments for present-day patients' foot problems.

Question: What was the previous understanding regarding the intended function of the raised arch?
Answer: The spring-like arch helped to lift the body into the next step.

Question: Who conducted the research, and where was it published?
Answer: The research was conducted by Lauren Welte, the first author of the study in Frontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology. She researched while at Queen's University and is now affiliated with the University of Wisconsin-Madison.

prompt:
Parse this text for all words and phrases related to space travel and arrange them in a comma-separated list in the order they appear in the article.

On April 20, 2023, a new SpaceX rocket called Starship exploded over the Gulf of Mexico three minutes into its first flight ever. SpaceX is calling the test launch a success, despite the fiery end result. As a space policy expert, I agree that the “rapid unscheduled disassembly” – the term SpaceX uses when its rockets explode – was a very successful failure.

A large rocket standing next to a tower.
The full Starship stack comprises a Starship spacecraft (in black) on top of a rocket dubbed Super Heavy (in silver) and is nearly 400 feet (120 meters) tall. Hotel Marmot/Flickr, CC BY-SA
The most powerful rocket ever built
This launch was the first fully integrated test of SpaceX’s new Starship. Starship is the most powerful rocket ever developed and is designed to be fully reusable. It is made of two different stages, or sections. The first stage, called Super Heavy, is a collection of 33 individual engines and provides more than twice the thrust of a Saturn V, the rocket that sent astronauts to the Moon in the 1960s and 1970s.

The first stage is designed to get the rocket to about 40 miles (65 kilometers) above Earth. Once Super Heavy’s job is done, it is supposed to separate from the rest of the craft and land safely back on the surface to be used again. At that point the second stage, called the Starship spacecraft, is supposed to ignite its own engines to carry the payload – whether people, satellites or anything else – into orbit.

An explosive first flight
While parts of Starship have been tested previously, the launch on April 20, 2023, was the first fully integrated test with the Starship spacecraft stacked on top of the Super Heavy rocket. If it had been successful, once the first stage was spent, it would have separated from the upper stage and crashed into the Gulf of Mexico. Starship would then have continued on, eventually crashing 155 miles (250 kilometers) off of Hawaii.

Read news coverage based on evidence, not tweets
During the SpaceX livestream, the team stated that the primary goal of this mission was to get the rocket off the launch pad. It accomplished that goal and more. Starship flew for more than three minutes, passing through what engineers call “max Q” – the moment at which a rocket experiences the most physical stress from acceleration and air resistance.

A cloud of fire and smoke in the sky with pieces falling Earthward.
The Starship spacecraft and Super Hheavy rocket were unable to separate during the flight, so engineers blew up the full rocket. AP Photo/Eric Gay
According to SpaceX, a few things went wrong with the launch. First, multiple engines went out sometime before the point at which the Starship spacecraft and the Super Heavy rocket were supposed to separate from each other. The two stages were also unable to separate at the predetermined moment, and with the two stages stuck together, the rocket began to tumble end over end. It is still unclear what specifically caused this failure.

Starship is almost 400 feet (120 meters) tall and weighs 11 million pounds (4.9 million kilograms). An out-of-control rocket full of highly flammable fuel is a very dangerous object, so to prevent any harm, SpaceX engineers triggered the self-destruct mechanism and blew up the entire rocket over the Gulf of Mexico.

All modern rockets have mechanisms built into them that allow engineers to safely destroy the rocket in flight if need be. SpaceX itself has blown up many of its own rockets during testing.

Success or failure?
Getting to space is hard, and it is not at all unusual for new rockets to experience problems. In the past two years, both South Korea and Japan have attempted to launch new rockets that also failed to reach orbit. Commercial companies such as Virgin Orbit and Relativity Space have also lost rockets recently. None of these were crewed missions, and in most of these failed launches, flight engineers purposefully destroyed the rockets after problems arose.

SpaceX’s approach to testing is different from that of other groups. Its company philosophy is to fail fast, find problems and fix them with the next rocket. This is different from the more traditional approach taken by organizations such as NASA that spend far more time identifying and planning for possible problems before attempting a launch.

The traditional approach tends to be slow. The development of NASA’s Space Launch System – the rocket that will take astronauts to the Moon as part of the Artemis program – took more than 10 years before its first launch this past November. SpaceX’s method has allowed the company to move much faster but can be costlier because of the time and resources it takes to build new rockets.

SpaceX engineers will look to identify the specific cause of the problem so that they can fix it for the next test launch. With this approach, launches like this first Starship test are successful failures that will help SpaceX reach its eventual goal of sending astronauts to Mars.

prompt: Write me part of a song about growth even in the face of difficulties. It should be fairly short, maybe only two verses and the chorus, and reference the sturdiness and hardiness of a tree at least once.

messages.content: Write me part of a song about growth even in the face of difficulties. It should be fairly short, maybe only two verses and the chorus, and reference the sturdiness and hardiness of a tree at least once.

[Verse 1]
Slowed down to a crawl
My head is in the gutter
I couldn't see at all
And it wasn't getting better

[Verse 2]
Like an oak tree
In the hard and lonely city
Resilient to the memory
Of everything that you did to me

[Chorus]
And I'm growing
I'm changing
In spite of all I'm going through
I'm showing
You'll never phase me
